Summary Heading: Great location, but rooms getting old
Summary: Overall the staff at this hotel is very nice, and the lobby was just remodeled so it looks brand new.  The rooms however did not get done.  they are clean but getting very old, bedding is worn out.  It is time for Hilton to give this place a full face lift.
Manager Response: Thank you for your consideration and feedback. You are aboslutely correct, our lobby just went through a renovation last September. Our next order of business is our guest rooms. We are planning to renovate our guest rooms within the next 6 months. Hopefully next time you stay with us, we will have gotten that facelift that you mentioned in your comment!

Summary: Hotel was very nice, staff was helpful, room was clean and the towels and wash clothes were done as additional decor, very cool.  It was located close to a lot of things, Disneyland, Downtown Disney and more Restaurants not part of Disney. Parking was a little limited. Over all experience was very nice.....
Manager Response: Thank you for appreciating our helpful staff and clean rooms. We recently had a training session for our housekeeping staff to teach them how to make origami out of washclothes and hand towels. It looks like our training session paid off! Thank you for pointing out the glory of our location. Even though we are a couple blocks south of Disneyland, we still have plenty of great restaurants and convinient stores closeby. Parking can be limited on sold out nights but let our front desk know if you are having trouble finding a spot, they are trained to be proactive when it comes to guest service.

Summary Heading: Nice place at a good price
Summary: Clean facility, friendly staff, quiet rooms, reasonable price.  Arrived when the weather was 100+ degrees and my room was able to remain cool and comfortable.  Fitness facility was on the smaller side but good enough.  Pleasant greeting as we initially checked in.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback. We always love to hear about how much our hotel is enjoyed. Everything from our comfortable rooms to helpful staff can be found here on a consistent basis, no matter how hot the weather may be outside. Although our fitness facility is small, we did just update it with brand new equiptment. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. He is a Hilton Diamond Level. I must first say that the staff are very friendly. They were always greeting us and asking if all was well. The room we were given had 2 Queen Beds. We immediately called down to say we had requested a king. None was available that evening, but "they would do what they could tomorrow". Never heard another word. We decided it wasn't worth the hassle. The room was clean and acceptable for a Value Hotel. We've stayed in many Garden Inns, and this was sub par with others. The bathroom had stains on the floor and toilet paper that would sand down a piece of wood!  The last day we returned in the evening and our room had never been cleaned. Apologies were made. It's basically a good place for families to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I feel bad that your stay was less than perfect with us. We are about to start a renovation on our rooms which will make a huge difference in terms of our bathroom floors and toilet paper. Since we are in the Disneyland area, most of our rooms have 2 queensize beds. We apologize that we did not have a king bed available and we understand how important that was to you. If you stay with us again, please feel free to call us ahead of time and confirm your roomtype. Sometimes, roomtype confirmation helps our staff strategize when we are pre-assigning rooms in the morning.

Summary: I was in Anaheim for a conference at the Convention Center and the Hotels next to the center was sold out.  I was pleasantly surprise with my stay at Hilton Garden Inn.  The room and amenities were great for about half the price.  I had a rental car but did not use it because everything was within walking distance.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Your statement capitalizes on one of the main reasons I love this hotel. We are right next to all the hustle and bustle of the Disneyland/Convention area. We are far enough that our rates are reasonable and we are fortunate enough to have a  variety of great restaurants within walking distance. We hope you choose us again next time you are in the area and thank you for recommending us!

Summary: I stayed here for a convention at the Anaheim Convention center. It was a short 10-15 min walk - which was beautiful and absolutely worth the savings. The room was $129 a night (compared to >$250 per night at the convention hotels). The desk staff was wonderful but I did find the restaurant staff at breakfast to be less then attentive. The hotel was extremely clean, the pool area was nice, the business center was very updated and easy to use. Additionally they had fresh fruit infused water in the lobby regularly as well as cookies in the afternoon. Breakfast was very fresh and delicious-  for $12.95 you had your pick of fresh made to order items (omlets, french toast, etc) as well as a regular breakfast buffet for fruit, cereals, and pastries. Well worth the money. The room had
Manager Response: I'm glad you were able to experience our clean rooms and convinient location. In addition, thank you for letting us know about the mini-fridge in room 418. We always apprecaite feedback and will do everything we can to fix it. I agree with you that our hotel is a great value. I apologize that your experience at our restaurant was less than perfect. I will pass your feedback on to my staff so we can improve for you next time.

Summary Heading: Unremarkable hotel, competent staff, convenient for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed recently for four nights while on a family trip to Disneyland.  Nothing about the hotel itself would distinguish it from other nearby properties.  Rooms are clean and well maintained; rates are reasonable.  Breakfast was reasonably priced, filling and well-prepared.  Loren was our waitress all four days and provided memorably great service.  She worked quickly and efficiently to to serve an amazing number of people at the same time.  We did not eat dinner at the hotel so I cannot speak to that service.  There is a quick, convenient, dedicated shuttle to and from Disneyland which runs back and forth every half hour ($5 per day).  For the limited time we were in the room the hotel served our purposes quite well.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We greatly appreciate your feedback and hope you and your family will return. Our staff is known to provide exceptional service and it seems like we succeeded once again. We look forward to seeing you back and urge you to call us next time you are planning a trip out to our area.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Good hotel.  Nothing special, but has bar, restaurant, marketplace to buy beer after hours.  Staff is helpful.  Rooms are clean.  There is a shuttle every 30 minutes to the Disneyland.  If you are on a budget and need a good place to sleep while visiting Disneyland worth staying
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback,  We are appreciate your acknowledgement of our new bar and restaurant area. Our staff is hired and trained to reflect the core values of our company. The simplicity of our hotel is what makes it preferable. We are glad you have enjoyed our clean rooms and accomodating staff. We all anticipate your return in the near future!

Summary: It's very comfortable. Great room and the breakfast complete.. The employee, was simphaty, the room always clean...... I suggest for bussisnes trip and vacation with family. There a good restaurantes and closet of yhe disney
Manager Response: You are absolutely correct,   From our location to our conscientious staff, we like to think this property is on point. Our breakfast is not only delicious but a great value as well. All our staff are trained to empathize in order to maximize guest comfort. Thank you for your feedback, we look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary Heading: An unusually good staff at Hilton Garden Inn-
Summary: We have stayed several times over the past 5 years and are always amazed by the friendly manner of all the staff here. Very accommodating and welcoming. The breakfast staff is phenomenal and usually over worked. Someone to bus tables more consistently would be helpful. We have come to know Rigo and crew and he always treats us like royalty.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response,  5 years of staying with us is extremely significant and we appreciate your loyalty. We are glad you love our amazing staff and Rigo especially. He is truly an asset to our team and we always like hearing nice things about him. An additional buser was recently hired and we thank you for your feedback. We will be sure to ackowledge Rigo for his hard work and let him know to keep it up! We look forward to having you back soon.

Summary: Stayed there for the Heli Expo. Good location, close to Restaurants in walking distance. Was full house that time, so room service took little longer, but still ok. No restaurant, but many in walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback,  We understand Heli-Expo was a busy time for us. We apologize that room service took a little while. Our chef takes pride in every dish to make sure it is prepared correctly and deliciously. Our location is part of what makes our property great. Even though we are 3/4 of a mile from the Disneyland Theme Park, we are surrounded by great restaurants on both sides of our property.

Summary: Great experience. Wonderful staff. Clean room, free internet and parking. Hard to believe how quiet and well-run everything was. Extremely responsive to any and all needs. Margaret, Marian, and Cosme are amazing staff. You will be happy you picked this Hilton. It's a gem. Applause!
Manager Response: We are glad you have enjoyed our clean rooms, complimentary wifi and accomodating staff. Kosme, Mariah and Margaret are a few members of our core staff and will be ackowledged for their hard work. With our newly remodeled lobby, I like to compare our property to a gem as well. Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you back soon!

Summary Heading: Very clean, nice room, super friendly staff
Summary: The room was super clean and the beds were very comfy.   The staff were extremely friendly.   Close to everything.   Would definitely stay here again.  The only issue I had was the continental breakfast was not complementary (which I thought it was).   My husband paid $12 for a muffin.  But after talking with the manager, he discounted breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback,  We are glad you got to experience our super clean rooms and comfortable beds. We take pride in our staff and it makes me happy to see they have succeeded in making you happy. I apologize about the breakfast misunderstanding, if you have any questions about pricing please don't hesitate to call me at (714) 703-9100 (ext. 2137) or my email is: keith.moses@hilton.com.

Summary Heading: Service is great, room is good but amenities not so
Summary: Not the best Hilton hotel I've stayed in.  Staff were friendly and room has the usual Hilton quality bed & sheets.  However, bathroom had stains on the floor and tv does not work well (cable signal is too low so your shows get interrupted a lot and you need to wait a minute or two after you change the channel before it actually changes).  Room phone also does not have dial tone and did not get fixed after it was reported.  WIFI signal is good but ensure that they spell your last name correctly so you won't have issues connecting.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback,  Our staff's professionalism is what makes me happy to work here. Our phones, TV network, bathroom and floors in general are all looking to be redone within the very near future. We recently updated our lobby and will be undergoing the same renovation on our rooms next. I'm sure our staff anticipates your next visit and we will do all we can in the meantime to improve.

Summary: All snug and nestled between several other towering hotels is the Hilton Garden Inn, in Anaheim, Garden Grove, minutes from Disneyland.  The staff were outstanding during my entire stay.  I was there for 6 days on a business trip.  They were welcoming, friendly, attentive and always smiling.  Whether it was their nature or good corporate training, it worked for me.  The rooms were very comfortable and clean.  The restaurant staff were extremely cordial and friendly.  After the hustle and bustle of attending the conference all day, I was more than happy to know that I was coming back to my transient residence with big smiles and a very warm, "Welcome back, how was your day?  If you need anything let us know.  I will stay there again.
Manager Response: I love reading comments such as yours,  I couldn't agree more when you say our staff is: "Welcoming, friendly, attentive and always smiling." We carefully pick each memebr of our staff to make sure they treat our guests like VIPs. Our property has a nice location and it seems you have done a good job of mapping out our great surrounding restaurants. Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to having your stay with us next time you're in town.

Summary Heading: Couldn't be happier with this hotel!
Summary: First off, I must say that I researched, researched, and researched some more before deciding on this hotel!  I'm very picky on what hotels my family stay at and I could not be more pleased with this choice.  My family stayed for 4 nights in two adjoining rooms.  The rooms were clean, staff was very friendly, and they provided good breakfast options to start the day before heading to Disneyland!  That took the burden off of having to find a place for breakfast.  Plus kids eat free with paying adults.  Rigo (Suave ;-) ), in the dining area, greeted us every morning with a smile and even went out of his way to say goodbye to us as we checked out.  Since it's a smaller hotel, getting from the parking lot up to your room is a breeze.  Hardly had to wait for the elevators.  We bought
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback,  We love hearing great things about our staff. Rigo especially, does a fine job of embodying the spirit of hospitality. It sounds like you enjoyed our clean rooms and helpful staff and we look forward to having you back again soon. I'm really glad the adjoining rooms worked out for you. If you plan on needing adjoining rooms in the future, please feel free to call us ahead of time so we can input that as a request on your reservation.  Thank you for staying with us!

Summary: This is a nice quiet small hotel located not too far from the Anaheim Convention Centre and Disney. There is ample parking and a small pool area.   Over the road is a Target store. My room had a mini fridge and microwave so having the target close by was handy.   Staff friendly and the establishment was nice and clean. Rooms of good size and quality but not ultra modern.  There is a small restaurant/bar but it does not appear to offer room service.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback,  Our location is part of what makes our hotel great. Having Target closeby is a very good combination in regards to our in-room mini-fridges and microwaves. We are lucky to have such a great staff. They never cease to amaze me with their hospitality. Our rooms are looking to be updated within the near future so they might look more modern next time you are in town but should have the same cozy feel. For your next visit, we just updated our room service menu and would encourage you to try it out. Our chicken pesto sandwich is definately worth a try!

Summary: We stayed here the first week of April and could not have been happier with our accommodations. The room was very quiet and clean. The thermostat was easy to set and the beds were comfortable, so we all slept very well. The lobby was absolutely beautiful; they did a wonderful job refurbishing it. We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful comments, we are so glad that you like the new look of our recently renovated lobby! We look forward to seeing you back soon!

Summary: Friendly and helpful desk personnel, restaurant waiter, Manager.   Made reservations with Mark who was also friendly and knowledgeable.   Within 5 minutes of Disneyland, Downtown Disney and Roy's restaurant.   Dinner and breakfast was delicious.   Worth the price.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for mentioning our friendly associates who were able to accomodate your needs. It really means something when you remember the person who booked your reservation by name! We hope to see you back again soon!

Summary: We were made to feel very welcome by reception staff.   Our hotel room was of a good size, very modern and clean, as was the bathroom.    The bed was very comfortable.     We caught the shuttle to Disneyland (it leaves outside Embassy Suites next door) costs $5, but you can come and go all day for that cost.     Breakfast was very good, plenty of choice, either continental or full cooked breakfast.     Hotel in a quieter part of Anaheim, but plenty of restaurants and a Target Shop across the road, which was very handy.    Hotel room has a microwave and refrigerator.
Manager Response: This is a wonderful, informative response that really lets our potential guests know about all of the wonderful things the HGI has to offer. Thank you so much for taking the time out to let everyone know.

Summary: We had a great time and the hotel was a big part of it. The location is really close to Disneyland and is very convenient to parking for the day. It is also very near downtown Disney with easy access. The hotel was clean, quite, with nice rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially with a issue we had with having booked a double room that they ran out of. The made up the issue by comping our breakfast and parking. Overall, I was very impressed with the hotel.
Manager Response: We are so glad you were impressed by the hotel! When you are competing with with the service at Disney and we stand out as a big part of the great weekend it says volumes about the service! We hope to see you back in the future!

Summary: A clean, comfortable hotel in close proximity to the convention center, and much more affordable than most other hotels in the area. The only problem I encountered was a sporadic Wi-Fi connection in the room.
Manager Response: We are so glad that we were able to provide you with clean, comfortable accomodations during your stay! Please note that we are investigating any WiFi issues that have been occuring and are in the process of expanding the bandwidth available in the upcoming month.

Summary: This hotel is nearly walking distance to the Magic Kingdom, but is free from the congestion and honkytonk across from the gates. Good alternative for business travel or families that do want to see Mickey.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting others know that the HGI really works for anyone visiting the Disneyland area who are looking for a quieter option for their accomodations.

Summary Heading: All Details taken care of by staff
Summary: We were attending an Expo and hotel was booked solid. In spite of this, the staff made us comfortable and attended to all our needs.  We stayed for 5 days and staff were all very helpful. Very clean rooms, hot tub, bar area and again the staff made the difference.
Manager Response: We are so happy we were able to attend to all of your needs during what was an extremely busy time in the Anaheim/Garden Grove vicinity! We hope to see you come back for pleausre on the next trip!

Summary: This hotel offers the best in accomodations and absolutely the most courteous, knowledgeable and friendly staff I've ever come across.  We travel here once a year for a convention and have never been disappointed.  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!  Will stay here any and every time I'm in Anaheim
Manager Response: Wow, now this is an awesome review! Thank you so much for letting others know about our awesome staff! We look forward to seeing you soon (or maybe next year!).

Summary Heading: You won't find better for this price
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for a conference in Newport Beach. It wasn't the closest accommodation for that purpose, but it was a great experience, I'm so glad I canceled the expensive conference hotel and stayed here instead.  PROS:  It was a great bargain with my AAA rate.   Excellent staff. When booking I forgot to enter a coupon code for a free breakfast, and the check in staff gave me coupons to comp my breakfast anyway. That simple gesture speaks volumes about how this staff treats guests. It wasn't necessary or expected, but it was greatly appreciated.The staff was extremely friendly and efficient.   Cleanliness. The room was immaculately clean. I walked around the room in white socks and there wasn't a speck of dirt on them.   Location. There are ample restaurants within
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful comments about the staff, cleanliness of rooms, location, and well appointed rooms. Sounds like we did a great job! I am sorry you had any issues (albeit minor), next time you are in the area we will strive for perfection!

Summary Heading: Great Stay, Great Location, Great Service
Summary: I've stay at quite a few location in Anaheim/ Because I'm a huge Disney Fan/ This hotel offer quite a bit, Five dollars for shuttle service to and from Disneyland. The room are just the right size, They provide a microwave and fridge, which is nice when you have left over from Outback, Ruth C, or other restaurants in the area.  Target is also located less then a block away for anything you would need for the family.  This location is very clean , and housekeeping staff is amazing . I found nothing but excellent service and I'll be returning next week with the family .
Manager Response: With all of the choices that you have when you are in the Anaheim area, I am so glad that we stand out enough to bring you back again! Thank you for letting others know about your clean room, great location, and most importantly the amazing service provided! Next time you are in please stop by to say hello!

Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel.  The staff were all excellent.  Without exception, every staff member was friendly and helpful - better than I have ever experienced at any hotel anywhere.  We had a bed and breakfast deal which was excellent value. The made to order breakfasts were very good, and there were also some great options if you just wanted to grab something quick and go. The lobby area has been nicely renovated since our last stay and I understand the rooms are getting done next, although there was nothing wrong or dated with our room. The room was clean, quiet and the maids did a very good job.  I highly recommend this hotel with no reservations whatsoever. Pardon the pun.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and for your loyalty. We appreciate your business and not to mention the recognition of our wonderful staff. We do our best to provide top quality service from our Front Desk Agents to our Housekeepers. Also, I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast in our newly renovated lobby/dining area. Next time you're in town, please stop by and say Hello!

Summary: The room was clean and filled with everything we needed.  The fitness center is next to the pool which was very convenient.  Very close to Disneyland but I love that there is a shuttle bus being that we have to  pay $12 a day for parking, I didn't want to have to pay for Disney parking too!  Overall experience was great.  The breakfast could be a little more freshly made but they have muffins and toast if you're not a big eater.
Manager Response: Glad to hear that your last stay with us was a "Great" one! With our close proximity to Disneyland, we understand there are many hotels to choose from, which is why I am happy you chose to stay with us. Also, having the shuttle bus for our guests visiting Disneyland is a great amentiy. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: We had booked this hotel as it is near to Disney and so it was.  Rooms are clean and tidy, adequate for our needs with everything you would expect.  Beds are comfortable.  It is approximately a mile drive to Disney.  We didn't use any of the facilities in the hotel, pool, bar, breakfast etc, but just used it as a base for Disney.  Unfortunately our fridge in our room 226 froze everything solid - thermostat is obviously broken.  We should have mentioned it, to management.  Being British we like our tea and had bought milk to have our tea but it was frozen.  But honestly, we were out from early morning to late at night at Disney so the last thing you want to do is ring maintenance when you have been out at Disney all day.  Also the outside of the windows were filthy - ring those
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us while visiting Disneyland. I am saddened to hear that we dropped the ball on your Mini-Refrigerator and the Windows. I want to apologize for our staff overlooking those aspects of the room. Next time you are in town, please choose to stay with us again and if there is ever anything that is not to your satisfaction with your room, please let myself know. General Manager - Keith Moses

Summary: If you are looking for a place to stay with your club sports team this is the right place. Clean rooms and polite hardworking staff. Free breakfast and the pool is right next to the dining/bar area. :) The food is good (burgers, wings and salad etc.)and the prices are fair. Plus you are walking distance to several diffferent family friendly restaurants.
Manager Response: At the Hilton Garden Inn-Anaheim/Garden Grove, we love to have clubs/sports teams stay with us during their competitions in the nearby area. I'm also glad that you enjoyed dining with us in our dinner restaurant, which is a new addition to the hotel. We hope to have the club/sports team stay with us again in the near future.

Summary: We reserved this hotel because of it's proximity to my son's basketball tournament (not Disney). However, if we wanted to go to the theme park or other surrounding attractions, we're just a hop, skip, and jump away! Breakfast in the morning was decent. My daughter enjoyed the pool. It's a great location for a sunny day or evening walk. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Service has been great!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your son's basketball tournament! Housing and taking care of sports teams that attend local tournaments is a major priority of ours. We love to go above and beyond, in terms of service, for our guests and really extend our sincere gratitude for having the team choose to stay with us. I'm also happy to hear that our pool and spa areas were put to great use with your daughter, it is always nice to slow down and enjoy the weather. When you come into town again, please choose to stay with us again.

Summary: This hotel is conveniently located near the convention center.  A nice walk on a sunny California day.  Also, the new lobby and bar make it even nicer stay.  The bar is not open late, but offers a nice stop after all day meetings to grab a drink before heading out for dinner in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for making us your choice of stay while attending the nearby Anaheim Convention Center! With our newly renovated lobby and dining area, I am glad that you were able to visit our bar, and that it actually made your stay a more enjoyable one! If you are ever in the area again for business or leisure, please stop by and visit us.

Summary: Warm friendly staff, really enjoyed staying there, the room was quiet and attractive decor. Easy to check in and self check out saved time. It was close to Disneyland and easy to get to from the highway 5.
Manager Response: Reading comments such as yours about how "super nice" our staff is, really provides evidence to how we strive to provide the best guest service. I appreciate you choosing to stay with us and next time you are in town, please stop by and say Hello!

Summary: Stayed here during the busy weekend of the Tinkerbell races at Disneyland.  Parking was hard to find but this is one of the few good hotels in the area that still provides free parking for guests. Friendly staff, clean rooms and free wifi all make this a great place to stay when visiting the area. Within walking distance to numerous restaurants.
Manager Response: Glad to hear that your recent stay with us was a nice one! Every year Disney has their Tinkerbell Marathon races, we strive to do our best in accomodating our friendly neighbors down the street. Hopefully when the next marathon is in town, we will have you as our guests again. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: Very accommodating, good location, very good Value. POOL is in the right spot.. SUN SIDE!!  Breakfast is Great, whether you want it cooked or just a quicky continental.   This was a great location for Disney or Angels ballpark.  Decent restaurants are very close by and a Target.  A+++
Manager Response: I am happy that you received great value for what you have paid with us. We do our best in accomodating and providing great guest service. Also happy to hear that you were able to enjoy our cooked to order breakfast with us! Next time you are in the Disney area, please choose to stay with us again.

Summary: Hotel is very nice.  Room had a mini fridge, microwave, and plenty of cabinets/drawers.  You can adjust the softness/firmness of the bed (not a Sleep Number) and it was very comfy.  They have a shuttle to Disney available for a small fee.  They also had tickets available for purchase at the front desk.  There are several restaurants nearby or you can eat at the hotel.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again.  I had a GroupOn deal which made this very affordable and cheaper than other hotels in the area.
Manager Response: I want to extend a big thank you to our Groupon guests! We are happy to have you here and glad you were able to take part in a great deal! From what I have read, it seems our amenities came to good use during your stay such as our shuttle to and from the Disneyland Resort. When you plan on visiting Anaheim again, please keep us in mind.

Summary Heading: A great hotel with FABULOUS staff and perfect location!!!
Summary: We just stayed here this past weekend and I have to honestly say that it was perfect.  My kids were greeted with a toy from the front desk upon check in.  We had breakfast in the hotel each morning ($12.95 per adult and kids eat free).  You got a choice of eggs, bacon, saus, waffle, pancake, etc and the rest was buffet style - fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal, coffee/tea, yogurt, lots of different juice.  For us, a family of 4, it was a really good deal!! My daughter got very sick on our second day and within minutes housekeeping was at our door cleaning up the bed and changing the sheets - all with a smile on their face!  After that, everytime we saw the housekeeping staff, my daughter would run up and say thank you and give them a big hug.  They were so sweet to her!!  I sent some
Manager Response: Wow! I love to read comments such as yours. This is evident on how great the staff is here at our hotel and how we attain our goal of going above and beyond for each and every one of our guests. It looks like there were some minor bumps during your stay, but I'm glad that our housekeepers were able to service your room in a timely manner, and also that you were greeted with smiling faces daily. Next time you're in town, please stop by and say Hello! P.s. Hope your daughter is feeling much better.

Summary: When traveling in the Disneyland area, the place to be is the Hilton Garden Inn.  The breakfast is perfect when you pay for the bed and breakfast deal on-line.  Plenty of great food to fill you up on a long trip to the Magic Kingdom.  Their staff and crew are simply awesome.  You will not be disappointed!
Manager Response: Reading a review such as this is great and rewarding. Also, I'm glad to hear that you were able to book the bed and breakfast package, which is a great package for guests wanting to having breakfast with us daily. Great guest service is a goal we strive for, and it is evident with you recent stay with us. Thank you very much for your patronage.

Summary Heading: Experience at Hilton Garden Inn Garden Grove
Summary: Booked this room about 4 months prior to visit. My family and i statyed there for New Year's Eve and had a great time. The Staff was very helpful and the room was neat, clean and the items i pre-ordered were available. Will stay there again.
Manager Response: Sounds like your recent stay with us was an excellent one! New Year's Eve is always a fun time in Anaheim, and I'm happy that you allowed us to be your choice of stay. We hope to have you as our guests again in the near future. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: The location is great, close to Disneyland and several good restaurants.  It is a well run property with an excellent staff.  We've stayed in several hotels near this property and this one provides the best value
Manager Response: I know that there are many hotels in the surrounding area, but we are extremely glad you chose to stay with us. We do our best in providing great guest service, as well as providing value for money spent. Next time you are in town, please stop by and say hi.

Summary: I have stayed here often. Hotel is well kept and staff is polite, friendly and helpful. The location being close to Disneyland is a plus when on personal time and it is still a great place to stay for business trips.
Manager Response: We understand location is key when choosing a hotel, but being in close proximity to Disneyland means many hotels to choose from. This being said, it brings many different types of travelers, anywhere from families to corporate, we do our best in providing guest service, even if it means customizing a few areas to accomodate. Thank you for your business and we look forward to having you as our guests again in the near future.

Summary: The hotel was overall clean however the standard of the fixtures, fittings and overall appearance did not seem to be to the normal HGI standards.  Price was not too bad, however it wasn't until after I booked and paid for (no cancellations) that I noticed it was $12 a nite to park the rental car (adds up when I stayed there for 5 nites). Beds were typically HGI firm. Breakfast was ok (nothing to write home about). Pool was OK but they were a little slow keeping the overall pool area tidy. Will give this HGI a miss on my next trip.
Manager Response: I am very sorry to hear that your recent stay with us was "Below average" I want to apologize for the parking charge inconvenience. I will make sure to communicate with the Guest service agents on clarifying the parking charge while reservations are being made. For the fixtures and fittings, we recently renovated our lobby and restaurant areas, but as far as the rooms go, we are working on a plan to upgrade them, hopefully sooner than later. Please do not hesitate to contact myself at Keith.Moses@hilton.com or by phone (714)620-2137 for your next stay with us so we can make sure to make things right this time around.

Summary: The hotel was nice and clean, but the shuttle service was not advertised to include a fee for the service.  When I asked about the shuttle service, the staff only answered the specific questions I asked, and I ended up having to come back with more questions about the service.
Manager Response: Sorry to hear that your recent stay with us was a disappointing one. For the shuttle service, you are correct, there is a daily charge for the service, and I understand that the price should be advertised. I want to apologize on behalf of our Guest Service Agents for dropping the ball on the information about the shuttle service, and more importantly the pricing information alone. I feel that it should have been stated to you once it was recognized you were a bit unfamiliar with the service. We would like to have you as guests again, so please choose to stay with us in the near future so we can make it right.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights with the kids while visiting Disneyland.  We live about an hour away and have stayed at many local hotels while visiting the mouse.  The lobby looks pretty new.  Rooms are the same as every other HGI in the country.  Rooms were ok.  Clean and big enough but nothing special.  Our room had 2 queens (better than having doubles).  I didn't hear road noise or noise from other rooms.  Our rate included breakfast.  It's not a buffet but it limited to basic breakfast fare.  On one of the beds, the dial to adjust the bed's softness was broken off so that you couldn't adjust it.  Overall, for what we paid, I was very happy.
Manager Response: I am very happy to hear that your last stay with us was a good stay. There are many hotels in the area, so I am very pleased to hear that we were your top choice. We did, in fact, recently renovate our lobby and restaurant area, very glad you took the time to notice. I will most definitely look into your reservation so we can get our maintenance staff to fix the adjustment dial on the bed that had it broken off. As always, it was our pleasure to have you as guests, and please choose to stay with us again in the near future.

Summary Heading: An overall Excellent stay at the Hilton Garden Inn
Summary: Although check in time is not until 3:00 pm, the front desk allowed for my husband & I to check in at 10:00 am.  We were able to parked our car & take the shuttle to Disneyland therefore saving us the cost of parking at Disneyland which is I'm sure a lot more than the cost of parking at the hotel.  I mostly appreciated that because I know from experience in staying at other hotels, that they don't always let you check in earlier than what you're supposed to.    Thank you, the service from all that attended us, was great.    Sincerely,  Jessie Ruano
Manager Response: Your "Excellent" stay with us is something we strive for. I am very happy to hear we were able to accomodate you with an earlier check-in time. We do our best to provide great and professional guest service by any means necessary. If in the near future you plan on staying with us again, please stop by and say Hello.

Summary: I liked the hotel.  It looks like they just recently renovated the lobby and I like the style.  I appreciated being able to order breakfast in the morning at a reasonable price.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to notice our recently renovated lobby and restaurant area. I am glad you were able to have breakfast with us as well. We pride ourselves on great guest service and in return, we hope for guest loyalty, which looks to be the case with you and your recent stay. Hope to have you back soon, and when in town, please stop by and say Hi.

Summary: Great location to Disney about 1+ miles= 30 minute walk with our young children.  With stroller and stuff to carry we just ended up walking and it wasn't bad.  Clean rooms and year round hot tub for those aches and pains of Disneyland for days on end.  We enjoyed the hotel for the time spent there.  The staff was even kind enough to get us a connecting room to our family. They were very accommodating.
Manager Response: Glad to hear your recent stay with us was great! We understand that our close proximity to Disneyland helps make us a top choice for guests, and we also understand that after spending the entire day or days there, it could bring those aches and pains, so it's nice to hear our spa was put to good use. Next time you are in town, stop by and say Hi.

Summary: As an HHonner member we love the Hilton. do we love this Hilton? no.  The staff yes.  The breakfast? No. it was terrible. It was a mass produced breakfast. That you do pay for. This is not a complimentary breakfast. The quality of the food was the worst.  The a/c in our room wasn't working due to someone unplugging it. we waited for maintenance for 30 minutes before I called the hotel staff to ask where maintenance was before i was told he was on another call that took priority. Now they did switch our room but it was very inconvenient considering we are like most people there, we are a family with two small children and it was 11 pm before we were settled in our new room.  The TV is on a high def antenna so we could not even watch the morning news because there was a loss of
Manager Response: I am deeply sorry to hear that your recent stay with us was a "Terrible" experience. I am glad that our staff was accomodating, but I am saddened by the fact that our amenities such as our air conditioning and television were such an inconvenience. I can assure you that we hold ourselves to higher standards than that of what you have experienced. Whenever possible, please contact myself by email at Keith.Moses@hilton.com or by phone at (714)620-2137, so we can discuss what we could do for you.

Summary: As soon as we got to the hotel we noticed that the look was very modern. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. My girls and husband got to enjoy the heated pool. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and smelled fresh. The location is very close to theme parks. The breakfast is cook to order.
Manager Response: I am extremely happy to hear that you had an "Overall excellent experience" with us. We recently went through a lobby and restaurant renovation and it is great to hear that it has had a positive effect on our guests. Also happy that you were able to take the time to enjoy our cooked to order breakfast with us too! We hope to see you and your family again real soon!

Summary: Hotel is clean and quiet. Typical Hilton Garden Inn. Have stayed here several times, but this time the room I had came with two huge bleach marks in the carpet. However, parking spaces are very small, and depending on how busy the hotel is, can get very tight.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us, we do appreciate your loyalty and business. I want to apologize for the bleach marks, I will make a note of this and take care of it right away, and recently, our parking spaces were reconstructed so that there would be more room to park. Thank you for taking the time to bring these areas of attention to us and as always, we look forward to having you as our guest in the future.

Summary Heading: Relaxing escape from conferences and attractions
Summary: This is a beautiful new hotel just off Harbor and a quart mile south of the convention center and almost across the street from the Disneyland parking lot. There is a $12 parking fee per night but it is waived if you are handicapped. Breakfast is not automatically included but there are often good bed and breakfast rates. The breakfast includes made to order omelets,fresh pancakes or French toast, as well as a buffet of pastries, fruit and yogurt. The staff is incredibly pleasant and fun to interact with too.
Manager Response: It is very satisfying to hear that we provided you with a "Relaxing escape" from your busy work schedule. Our made to order breakfast is a great amenity to our guests because of the many food choices available and our close proximity to local businesses and the Anaheim Convention Center make our hotel a top choice for business travelers. We look forward to having you as our guest again in the future.

Summary: It was a pleasure to stay at this Hotel. The supervisor there Haasan Torres I believe his name was, was helpful and kind. The staff during the morning breakfast was friendly and I thought it was very nice of them to give any and all kids that were there a toy while having breakfast.  Overall just a wonderful experience and would definitely stay at this hotel in the future.
Manager Response: Here at the Hilton Garden Inn, we strive to do our best in providing great and unique guest service. We understand that Disneyland is around the corner, so extending some of the Disney magic to the children of our guests is a nice little touch we like to add. Hassan Torres is a great employee and is incredible with our guests when it comes to top notch service. Please choose to stay with us again in the near future.

Summary: I booked 2 nights here through Groupon for $184. The price was great, the location was great, the service was great, but the beds not so great. Both were as hard as a rock and I like a firm bed. Apperently they are adjustable but there was no obvious way of knowing that or a sign.   The room was clean and yes it does need an update but not like it 50-60 years old.   Pool area was nice snd well kept. Temp was perfect.   Don't like having to pay for parking but it is what it is.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking advantage of our great Groupon deal. Our beds are the Garden Sleep System beds, and I want to apologize that you were not made aware that they could be adjusted. We usually have a sign at the front desk outlining this detail, but rest assured, I will make sure that all of our Guest Service agents extend this valuable information to each and every guest. Please do stay with us again so we can make your next stay right.

Summary Heading: Hotel Rooms need an update. Overall ok stay.
Summary: Rooms were very spacious but the carpeting, furniture, wall, decor, and lighting are badly in need of an update! When I entered the hotel lobby I thought the rooms would be as beautiful looking but it looked very dated. Bathroom had previous guest hairs lying around and parts of carpet were grimy.  I chose this hotel for it's location from the convention center. There are other hotels around the area that are nicer and closer.
Manager Response: Recently, we did go through a major lobby and restaurant renovation, however, our rooms do need to be updated. We do plan on renovating them in the near future, but as far the cleanliness of our rooms, we do our best in providing clean and neat guest rooms, however, I want to apologize for dropping the ball in this area.  I hope in the near future you would consider staying with us again so that we can make it right for you.

Summary Heading: Moderately priced hotel with welcoming staff!
Summary: Attractive, clean hotel within a mile and a half of Disneyland entrance, the Garden Grove Hilton Garden Inn was reasonably priced.  All staff members radiated genuine warmth and happiness, and went above and beyond expectations to make the stay pleasant.  It was possible to walk to Disneyland or take public transportation right out the front door!
Manager Response: It was great to hear that your recent stay with us was "above and beyond." The entire staff here at the Hilton Garden Inn-Anaheim/Garden Grove prides themselves on delivering the best guest service and creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Please visit us again soon, and while you're here, stop by and say Hi!

Summary: I choose this hotel because it's great location, refrigerator & microwave are included and it's a great value. Other hotels charge extra for fridge & microwave.  This is always my first choice even when I'm not visiting Disneyland.  This trip was to Hollywood but the hotels are ridiculously priced there.
Manager Response: Glad to hear that your recent stay with us was a great one! We do our best to accomodate our guests and having necessities such as a mini-fridge and microwave in the rooms really goes a long way. Next time you are in town, please stop by and say hello.

Summary: Stayed here before back in 2011 and had a great stay. This time not so much. The hotel's proximity to Disneyland assures it will have a lot of traffic. The hotel is is need of a definite remodeling, The public area's other than the dining area and check-in look a little rough. The elevators and hallways need attention too. Had a King bed room and was disappointed with what I found. The room was worn. The carpet was pulling away from the bathroom door and was frayed. The sink drained extremely slow and the tile was cracked near the shower. The worst part was the bed. The right side of the bed was like sleeping in a hole and the left side was like a rock. The bed's adjustment knobs did absolutely nothing. Made for a miserable nights sleep. I stay at HGI because of the bed's. Had
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that your last stay with us was an unpleasant experience. We are actually in the final stages of a major renovation to our lobby and dining areas, as well as the front desk. Thank you for bringing all of these specific room areas to our attention, we will look into fixing all of these issues. I am glad that we were able to come to an agreement with you for your stay, and I would like to welcome you back as our guests in our newly renovated hotel. Whenever possible, please contact myself either by phone at 714-620-2137, or by email at Keith.Moses@hilton.com.

Summary: The breakfast wasn't free even though our papers said otherwise. We weren't able to use our points or receive them. The beds were hard as a rock. Parking was always full.   We always love Hilton hotels so this was a shock for us.   The staff was helpful though and everything was very clean.
Manager Response: I want to apologize for your disappointing stay with us. Due to certain circumstances, if your reservation was booked through a third party company (ex. Expedia, HotWire, etc.), then Hilton Honor points would not be issued for the room and tax charges because those dollar amounts were not reconciled by our hotel. If this was not the case for you, please do not hesitate to contact myself and I can help you receive the Hilton Honor points you deserve. If possible, we would love for you to give us another try so we can make your stay right. You can contact me by email at Keith.Moses@hilton.com, or by phone at 714-620-2137.

Summary: My spouse, son and I checked in on October 10/13. We checked out on October 15/13.   We should have checked out sooner but didn't as this hotel was selected as part of a Westjet Vacations package.  I was very disappointed with our stay.  1. LOUD and CONSTANT humming noises  Upon arrival into our room on the 2nd floor, my spouse and I both immediately heard a very loud humming noise.   I contacted the front desk and was told that a maintenance worker  would be sent up.   This loud humming noise was a different noise than the humming noise coming from the mini fridge and the noise coming from the air conditioner/heating unit.   The maintenance worker told me that the humming noise was likely caused by construction in the kitchen.  He told me that the noise should stop when
Manager Response: I want to apologize for an unpleasant experience at the hotel and for dropping the ball on many occassions. Yes, we are undergoing a major renovation to the lobby, dining areas, and front desk, which could possibly explain the "humming" noise. We are doing our best at keeping the construction noise to a minimum for our guests, but at times it is a bit difficult. I understand that your reservation was booked through WestJet Vacations, whenever you have a chance, please contact myself so we can discuss what we can do to make this situation right. My email is Keith.Moses@hilton.com and my phone number is 714-620-2137

Summary: Clean rooms and we were generally happy with our experience.  The pool is teeny tiny, but we spent most of our time in Disneyland.  You have to pay for breakfast, so we just bought food at Target across the street and used the minifridge and microwave.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that your recent stay with us was a pleasant one. We pride ourselves on having very clean rooms and providing nothing, but the best service to all of our guests. I'm also happy to hear that you were able to go to our nearby neighbor, Disneyland, which is always a great time. Please do stay with us again in the near future, and while doing so, stop by and say Hi!

Summary: When we called to make the reservation we were not informed about on going construction. When we arrived we were shocked at what we found. The desk clerk informed us that the construction was running behind and they anticipated it would have been completed before we arrived. The morning breakfast was held in a conference room area. We chose to eat elsewhere. The parking lot is still horrible. Every night when we returned we could not find a parking spot in the Hilton Garden parking lot. We usually had to park in the farthest part of the lot for the Hampton. We were afraid that we would find our car towed because we were using there lot instead of the Hilton Garden.Charging us $15 dollars for parking is outright robbery when you can even park in the hotel lot. We took this
Manager Response: I want to apologize for the inconvenience that the hotel renovation has caused you during your stay with us. Of our many goals, one is to provide a "Stress Free Stay," but on occassions such as this, it is a bit difficult and I understand your frustration, and I can clearly see how we dropped the ball. Although the parking charge is actually $12, you are completely right about how the parking situation was during the remodeling process. Also, we pride ourselves in providing professional guest service and as a measure of this, we utilize Trip Advisor as a gateway to direct feedback with our recent guests.   Whenever time permits, please give myself a call at (714)620-2137, or email myself at Keith.Moses@hilton.com so that we can discuss about some adjustments I can make to your recent stay.

Summary: The hotel is in the process of a renovation and promises to look very nice. We stayed in one of the unrenovated rooms and discovered it to be clean and still in good condition. The beds were very comfortable ( Sleep number?). The location to Disneyland and the convention center is convenient as shuttles are available. Would definately stay here again as I found the staff welcoming and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you choosing to stay with us. Your positive comments about the outlook of our hotel renovation is very uplifting. We look forward to what this renovation has in store and we appreciate you taking the time to notice all of the wonderful services/amenities that our hotel has to offer. Please stay with us again in the near future as our lobby will be completely finished.

Summary: The lobby was promised to be completed before we arrived and it was not completed during our stay.  The side door (alternative lobby) was open the entire time -- day and night -- causing security concerns.  We had friends staying there who received free water from reception but we were asked to pay $1.00 per bottle.  A maintenance worker was using a smelly gas-powered leaf blower while my kids were swimming and someone was smoking poolside and no one spoke to her.  No one acknowledged my Hilton Honors status.  The fruit at the breakfast was not fresh -- old and mealy.  We will not stay there again.
Manager Response: I am very sorry to hear that your recent stay with us was not a great one. As I can see, we dropped the ball on many occassions with you during your stay. From the renovation not being done on time to not recognizing your Hilton Honor status, it is understandable where the frustration sets in. Providing great guest service is a priority of ours, as well as creating a welcoming and comforting experience for our guests, whenever you have a chance, please contact me by phone at (714)620-2137, or by e-mail at Keith.Moses@hilton.com so that we can further discuss anything I can do for you.

Summary Heading: Just 2 blocks from the Magic Kingdom
Summary: The lobby is being renovated at the moment, so there is quite a bit of noise during the day. Beware of that if you plan to stay in the next few weeks. Otherwise it is a great place to stay to visit Mickey Mouse and friends as the Magic Kingdom is just two blocks down the road. There are also plenty of restaurants and shopping centers around the area. The rooms are HGI standard and there is plenty of parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us, especially during our renovation period. Unfortunately, it can get a bit noisy during construction times, but I am glad that did not hinder your stay with us. We pride ourselves on our proximity to Disneyland and the many businesses that are available to our guests. In the near future, please stay with us again to see what our newly designed lobby and restaurant will look like.

Summary: Lobby and common areas under construction.  Confusion and chaotic check-in and navigation thru entire facility for any type of service or access.  Parking very limited due to numerous other hotels in area using parking lot facilities.
Manager Response: Sorry to hear that your recent stay with us was directly affected by the hotel renovation. You are correct about the lobby and common areas being renovated, and I want to apologize for the inconvenience this may have caused. We are doing our best in keeping the renovation to a minimum with our guests, but at times it is a bit difficult. Whenever time is available, please contact myself by phone at (714)620-2137 or by e-mail at Keith.Moses@hilton.com so that we can discuss what I can do for you.

Summary: The room itself was good but the lobby area was being remodeled therefore it was not open we had to enter through a side door and sign in at a counter in the hallway.  We were told there was a dining room open for breakfast and there was a room with cold cereal, milk, donuts and coffee.  We've stayed at Hilton Hotels before and this was not representative of the others we have stayed at.
Manager Response: Unfortunately, I am sorry to hear that your recent stay with us was not a great one. I understand that a hotel going through a renovation can have a negative affect on guests, which seems to be the case here. We are doing our best in keeping this renovation limited in affecting our guests, but at times, it is a bit difficult. If you have the time, feel free to contact myself by phone at (714)620-2137 or by email at Keith.Moses@hilton.com

Summary Heading: Nice hotel only 1 mile from Disneyland!
Summary: I was there for a Disney reunion-very nice hotel in need of updating-however the staff was WONDERFUL-very polite and accommodating in many ways.  Staff was willing to assist us with any request in there very limited area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your patronage. We pride ourselves on the hotel's close location to Disneyland and we're glad that you had a wonderful stay. Our staff prides themselves on being very accomodating to guests' needs. We are in the final stages of a lobby and restaurant renovation, and in the near future, please choose to stay with us again to see what our final product will look like. As always, thank you again for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: The parking lot was being resurfaced and the lobby was being remodeled.  Signs were posted to make finding the checkin easy but the parking lot that was open was very full.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  Easy elevator access and nice restaraunts are very close within walking distance for those that wish to do so.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us, your patronage is appreciated. Unfortunately, we were in the process of a lobby renovation, but I am very happy to hear that we were able to make your check-in process and stay a smooth and comfortable one. Please choose to stay with us again in the near future as our lobby renovation will be completed and do stop by and say hello.

Summary: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on 9/14/2013 and enjoyed my stay. I appreciated the convenient location in Anaheim, as I was attending a conference at the Honda Center, a few minutes away. The room was nicely done, with a mini-fridge and microwave, which was a plus. Loved the bed, slept like a baby. The lobby was under construction, so it was not as nice of a welcome as maybe it usually, is, but that was not really a problem since I only went through the alternate hallway-entrance a few times. Breakfast buffet was great, with a ton of selections. I was impressed and left full and happy!
Manager Response: Glad to hear that your recent stay with us on 9/14/2013 was a great one! We do have "Garden Sleep System" beds in each of our rooms and I'm happy you "Slept like a baby." Although our lobby was being renovated, I sure hope you do choose to stay with us again so you can see the final product. As always, we appreciate you choosing to stay with us!

Summary: Very nice hotel, close to disney, shuttel worked great. Hotel staff is very good and room are good. good value for the money. Overall good experinace, currently hotel under renovation, no impoact to the guests
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn-Anaheim/Garden Grove. It's great to hear that we provided you with great value for your money. Our staff go above and beyond for our guests, and the amenities such as the shuttle to Disneyland, really helps to provide a great service. I am also glad that our lobby renovation had no impact on your stay, which was our primary goal during this process. We hope to have you stay with us again very soon!

Summary: This hotel had easy access to Disney and was convenient to access the freeways as well.  Many dining options nearby.  It looks like their new lobby will be beautiful!  Tip:  there's a sporting goods store right accross the street where you can find great deals on boogie boards if you have an extra day to hit the beach.   Huntington Beach is a pretty easy drive and has great waves.
Manager Response: Location is a key factor when guests choose to stay with us. I am extremely happy to hear that everything in our location was very convenient for you and your family. Hopefully in the near future, when the lobby renovation is completed, you will come back and visit us to see how we have changed. As always, your business is much appreciated!

Summary: Anyone considering spending high dollar amounts or a large number of reward points be warned... the place is under construction, it is loud, and it is not worth the money or points when there are at least 7 other Hilton options out there in the area.  Don't make the same stupid mistake I did.
Manager Response: I want to apologize for the loud noises and inconveniences due to the lobby renovation. Personally, I can understand why you are disappointed with your recent stay. Whenever possible, please send an e-mail my way so we can discuss what we could have done better and/or what we could do for you at this time. Keith.Moses@hilton.com

Summary: The parking was horrible one night at the hotel.  Supposably Embassy Suites, which shares the parking lot, had a huge party and it got out of control.  There was no place for us to park.  The beds were amazing and the hotel was quiet.
Manager Response: I want to take this time to apologize for the inconvenience of our parking lot due to the festivities next door. Although the parking situation was not to your standards, I do appreciate you taking the time to point out how amazing our "Garden Sleep System," beds are. We do appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I usually stay at the Hilton down the street but it was booked solid because of the Disney Marathon which I was in town for so I booked the Hilton Garden Inn. The room was larger, quieter, and even had a Theraputic foam matress. It was the first time I was able to sleep soundly before a race. I received my 3AM wake up call right on time. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Glad to hear that your recent stay with us was a great one. It is always a pleasure to hear how we have surprised our 1st time guests with our amenities such as the "Garden Sleep System" beds. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we look forward to your next stay.

Summary: I can not say enough wonderful things about the staff! Housekeeping, breakfast crew, front desk, grounds people were all very friendly and helpful. We loved the location. We were close enough to shopping and restaurants and the shuttle to Disney was always on time. The pool was clean and very quiet so after a long day at Disney it was great to come back to. Would go back in a heart beat!
Manager Response: I am extremely happy to hear that your recent stay with us was a "Wonderful" one! Our entire staff prides themselves on providing great guest service and it is evident with the comments you have provided. I will most definitely pass this along to everyone and we cannot wait to have you stay with us again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great staff, great food, great service
Summary: I always enjoy my stays at the Hilton Garden. I travel a lot for work and the try to stay here whenever I can. The staff are always friendly and professional. The rooms are clean. There is typically free internet service. The breakfast is fresh and good food. The only thing that I am disappointed with is the fitness centers are typically small with not much equipment. But for the rest of the services and the price, I will always choose Hilton Gardens when I can.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your work trip. We do our very best in providing great service to our corporate guests and I am also happy to hear that you were able to use the complimentary wi-fi that we have available. Although our fitness center lacks in size, I do hope that our other amenities do make up in that area, and as always, we look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good location, close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is nice, close to Disneyland( 1-2miles), and also 15 miles from Huntington Beach, so it served our purposes. A lot of places around to eat or buy groceries. The only thing that I did not like was the fact that I had to pay $12/day for parking. The room was equipped with HD TV, fridge, microwave oven, and hairdryer which was really nice.
Manager Response: With our close proximity to Disneyland and other businesses, I am glad to hear that it was accomodating for you and your family. I am also happy to hear that your stay was a great one and next time you are in town, please stop by and say Hi.

Summary: There are 2 Hilton's on Harbor so when trying to locate this hotel on my IPhone (even with the address) it was taking me to the other Hilton so be careful and make sure it the address doesn't switch. I had a friend go to the other hotel and was completely lost. The front desk staff was very nice here and did what they could to make my stay comfortable.
Manager Response: First off, I apologize for the confusion on the directions to our hotel, I know it can be a bit difficult with a lot of other hotels in the area. However, I am glad you were able to find us and have a great stay. Hope to have you again in the near future.

Summary: Excellent customer service  I would truly reccommend this hotel to anyone, especially if  you are visiting Disneyland, CA   I enjoyed my stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly.   The food was good and the choices were plentiful.  Our server was nice and kind.  This was our second visit to this location (3 years apart) and both visits were coincidental- As my family found ourselves in the the area for an un-scheduled vacation I recalled the last visit to this hotel and it turned out to be a wonderful stay for the second time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty and patronage, your business is much appreciated. With Disneyland in our backyard, I am glad that our hotel was your choice of stay and that our staff was accomodating to your family's vacation. It is also good to hear that our breakfast restaurant, The Great American Grill, provided great food choices and service as well. Hope to have you and your family stay with us again soon.

Summary: Our stay was not what I imagined we would have at a Hilton Hotel. To be fair, this hotel is located near Disneyland, so if you're looking for a place close to an amusement park, you may be able to make this work. But we happened to be up for a family reunion in the area and I was disappointed that parking was such an issue (spaces are scarce in the evening -- as in, I got the last spot one night -- AND you're paying for parking each night), the beds were not what I imagined (in an effort to accommodate everyone, they have adjustable beds, but you can't sit on them while they're "adjusting" and it takes 45 minutes just to see if the adjustment is to your liking -- who wants to sit around in their hotel room waiting for that?), the bathroom shower curtain was torn, the towel rack
Manager Response: I want to take this time to apologize for your recent stay with us. I know that parking can be a bit difficult on high occupany nights, but know that we are currently renovating our parking area to accomodate nights such as this. Unfortunately, we seemed to have dropped the ball in certain areas of your stay and I would love for you to provide us with another chance at making it right. For your next stay, please contact myself at Keith.Moses@hilton.com or call (714)620-2137 so we can discuss how to make your next stay a more enjoyable one.

Summary: We booked three rooms for two nights for a family trip to Disneyland. The hotel was very clean and very quiet. All of us enjoyed the pool and the lobby coffee was excellent! The breakfast bar was reasonably priced and well stocked with the basics. The only negative is that this hotel doesn't provide a free shuttle to Disneyland. There is however a nearby shuttle which costs $5.00 per adult and $3.00 per child.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your family's trip to Disneyland. Glad to hear the pool was put into good use by your family as well as the "excellent" coffee that we provide each morning. Although we contract our shuttle to an outside vendor, I am glad that the minimal costs to board the shuttle was not a problem. Hope to have you and your family again in the future.

Summary: The name Hilton is, in my mind, synonymous with elegance and excellent service, regardless of the "grade level" of the property. My stay at a Hilton Garden Inn was marred when the housekeeper did not clean my room due to the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door at 10:40 a.m. I am handicapped and my sleep is often disrupted. I spoke with the manager at 11 a.m. who explained the system of housekeeping respecting privacy and then returning later, when the sign was removed, to clean the room. Well, no one did. I expected a clean room and some gesture of good will. I received neither. This experience diminished my opinion of the Hilton name.
Manager Response: I'm very sorry to hear that we failed to follow up with your room service. Although respecting guest privacy is a priority of ours, we do try our best to provide great service. When available, please e-mail myself at Keith.Moses@Hilton.com or call 714-620-2137 so we can discuss a "gesture of good will" on our part.

Summary Heading: No frills hotel for the price
Summary: Stayed here on business one night from 24th July 2013.   Pros:  1. Cheaper (paid $244) than many other hotels in the area. 2. Clean and basic  3. Friendly Staff 4. Free WiFi 5. Good for the solo traveler.  Cons: 1. None I can think of, but a colleague of mine said that her room stinked quite a lot.
Manager Response: It sounds like your recent stay with us was a great one! We do our very best to accomodate our business travelers by providing specific amenities such as complimentary Wi-Fi and our 24-Hour Business Center. On your colleague's room, it is unfortunate that we overlooked the smell of the room, but rest assured that we have taken care of the situation and we look forward to your future business travels with us.

Summary: Nice hotel.  Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly.  The bed was very, very comfortable.  I did not have the breakfast but it smelled great every morning.  I do wish the wifi was a little sharper.  The business center didn;t have the best printer or Internet connection.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and we do appreciate your feedback. Our "Garden Sleep System Beds" are a great amenity to our guests and I am glad that you were able to have a great experience with us. We hope to be your future choice in hotels, the next time you visit.

Summary Heading: Great staff, clean rooms, plenty of parking, cold water in the lobby
Summary: There are tons of hotels in the Disneyland area, granted, but the staff was always accommodating, offered us fresh water and baked goods. The room was clean, and it was very quiet. I would stay here again for sure. It's conveniently located near restaurants and within walking distance of banks and shopping.
Manager Response: I know that there are many hotels in the Disneyland area, but I am very glad you chose to stay with us. As you stated, we strive to do our best in accomodating our guests with great service and pleasant sleeping rooms. Our location is key and I am happy to hear that it is very convenient for you as well. The next time you are in town, feel free to stop by and say hi.

Summary: Before booking this hotel I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews on hotels near Disneyland and I am pleased to say that I found this hotel was everything that I needed.  As I was making the most of my short stay in Anaheim I did not spend much time in my room or at the hotel.  My room had a king size bed and although I was on my own it would be a suitable size for 2 adults. Although the décor is a little dated it was clean and tidy and had everything I needed.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the bathroom very clean.  My room was near the lifts and surprisingly very quiet, I only heard voices in the hallway a couple of times.  The staff were very efficient and helpful but I would have liked to see them smile more and look like they enjoyed working there.
Manager Response: Thank you for booking with us, your business is appreciated. Although you were not in your room often, I am glad to hear that it was up to your standards for a great guest room. At the Hilton Garden Inn-Anaheim/Garden Grove, we aim to acheive a great working environment and smiling faces is a result of this. In the near future, we do plan on renovating our decor, so the next time you are in town, please keep us in mind.

Summary: This is an older hotel and the rooms are a little dated but they are very clean and comfortable and quite spacious. Rooms have a small fridge, a desk and a microwave and a small range of items can be purchased from the pantry in the lobby at reasonable prices. There is a laundry with coin operated washer and dryer which we found helpful on a longer trip.   We stayed here to visit Disneyland and found it an ideal location. We paid $5 a day for the bus and given the close proximity we went to Disney early, came back for a short nap and then headed back later in the afternoon.    The front counter service was very efficient and friendly and responded helpfully to our requests. We ate breakfast at the hotel daily for pure convenience but found the staff were quite indifferent to us
Manager Response: It most definitely sounds like your stay with us was a pleasant one. Glad to hear that we were able to accomodate you with our in-room amenitites for your Disneyland trip. However, greeting our guests is a main priority at the hotel, I want ot take this time to apologize about the service provided in the restaurant. In the future, on your next visit to town, please give us a chance to make it right.

Summary: I would like to take this opportunity to say how impressed I was with the stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Garden Grove/Anaheim.  Not just me but my entire family.  I'd like to especially recognize two of the staff at the hotel for the exceptional service they have provided and would request that you please let them know and recognize their great customer service.  Firstly I'd like to recgonize Rigo (lastname?).. Rigo was the head Server in the American Grill restaurant located in the Hotel.  From our first morning breakfast, during our 7 day stay and right up to our check out morning breakfast.. Rigo made us feel so comfortable and provided us such great service..(spoiled us :) ) which I have never seen before in any of our stays at other Hotels.  After the first morning..
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that your recent stay with us was an "Excellent Stay" We do our best to provide the most outstanding service to each and every one of our guests, as evidence in Rigo and Ricky. I will most definitely pass on the great news to them and it is wonderful to hear how Rigo, Ricky, and the entire hotel staff were able to make you and your family so welcomed here with us. As always, we look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: The room was clean but dated.  The common areas were not very clean, however. It seems like a good property to stay at if you are going to Disneyland with children.  I was traveling for business and would not recommend the hotel for business travelers.  The most frustrating part of my stay was check-out.  I had prepaid for my room online through Hilton's online reservation system.  To get reimbursed, my company requires a receipt that shows a zero balance with the form of payment listed on it.  This has not been a problem at other Hilton properties.  However, the manager at this Hilton Garden Inn told me that because I had prepaid, "this property" was unable to print out a receipt that met my requirements. He was not very friendly about it.   I presume that the property received
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us, your business is much appreciated. I am sorry to hear that your check-out experience was unpleasant, to say the least. The reason we we're not able to provide the receipt was due to the fact that you booked through our Advance Purchases department, and the receipt they provide us are usually not accurate, in terms of financial figures. I want to apologize for this inconvenience, and although we pride ourselves in business travel, I do hope you will give us another chance to better serve you in the near future.

Summary: From check in to check out the staff at this hotel exceeded our expectations. This is a very busy hotel with many families. The staff was very skilled in meeting everyone's needs, and handed the mixture of their guest with ease.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us and expressing all of the wonderful comments about the staff. We do pride ourselves in great guest service, and although we are busy with many other guests, I am glad that we were able to accomodate you in a positive way.

Summary: I am very grateful to Ricky and his staff for saving me from myself. Briefly, I screwed up my reservation by a day and fond myself at 1:30AM with no hotel room for the next several nights. His night staff found me a room at another hotel and then Ricky worked his magic to find room for me in his fully booked facility.
