Kids were running and screaming up and down the hallways past 1 a .m. Calls to the front desk did little to fix the issue.   In the morning eating breakfast was chore. The wait staff was very slow to take cook to order food and delivering it. Then it too forever to settle the bill. Makes me wonder how many walk out from frustration on waiting both to
Manager Response: I want to thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience with us. I am so sorry to hear of the challenges you had with us during your stay. I am sorry that during your stay that we had some unruly children. Although we take great pride in our tasty breakfast and service as well as being one of the quieter hotels in the Anaheim area, there are times when we have groups that can create a little bit more noise than we would like. I have addressed the issues with all of the department heads to ensure we are better explaining the open parking in our entire lot and the service issues that occured. Please feel free to contact me at 714.703.9100 so that I may be able to discuss the issues that occurred and see what we can do to ensure your next stay with us is as great as the first one!

Summary Heading: Great staff, clean rooms, not far from convention center and Disney.
Summary: Inexpensive conference hotel that offered breakfast, free Internet, fridge and microwave.  Almost across the street from Target and shared parking lot with Bucca de Beppo
Manager Response: Thank you for the short, but sweet comments about our hotel. You hit on the cornerstones which arre great service, clean rooms, and ideal location! Next time hope to turn the four rating into a five!

Summary: The first thing about this hotel is the great staff.  As soon as we walked in we were met with smiles and the best attitude.  I asked for early check in and they accommodated my request, gave me coupons to local restaurants (which is great when traveling with kids), a map of the restaurant locations, and answered all my questions.  There's a Target across the street and a few nice restaurants really close by.  In addition, there's a shuttle to Disney that's convenient and cheap ($4 per adult, $1 per child).  The parking is hefty ($12) but comparable to what you'll pay at any of the hotels nearby.  If you're looking for an affordable, comfy stay, and don't mind the popcorn ceilings then this is the place to stay!    The rooms are a decent size, clean, and the beds were comfy
Manager Response: I want to thank you so much for your glowing review of the service we provided during your stay! We have a great team who really does know how to take care of our guests. Please know that I have addressed the issues that occurred with our housekeeping team to ensure consistency in all of our rooms. In regards to the knock on the door prior to 12:00pm check out time, we typically will check in with rooms prior to check out time as the majority of our guests leave much earlier than the required check out time and do not check out with the desk. We want to make sure our team is able to get into the rooms to ensure we have all of our rooms clean and ready to go by our 3:00pm check time. Thank you again for your comments and I pledge to make your next stay worthy of the five stars!

Summary: As student who travel more than 70 day a year. I consider myself a loyal customer for Hilton hotel brand. The room nothing special compare to Hampton and Double Tree, sometime little worst than other. The breakfast is over price and it is not as free as other Hilton Brand. Late cancel and late check out are usually happen because fly delay or important thing happen. However, the Hilton garden inn do not understand that and actually make me pay for that. I try stay 2 time at this brand, one in Anaheim and other in Las Vegas but it is worst experience for me. I rather stay at other brand or Marriott, at least they don't charge when your flight come late
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear about your disappointment with our hotel! I am sorry we were not able to accomodate your late checkout request. Although we always try accomodate up to 2:00pm when a late check out is requested, there are certain times when either too many requests have been made or  the hotel is extremely busy when a request may not be able to be accomodated. It is true we charge for breakfast (and it is a vastly superior breakfast to the complimentary you find at most places), but we do offer a children eat free where children under 12 eat free with a paying adult (one child per paying adult). I may also suggest booking into our Bed and Breakfast which builds the cost of breakfast into the rate at a nice discount. We hope to have the opportunity to ensure your experience is better heading into the future. Please feel free to contact me if I am able to assist in any way.

Summary: I have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in Anaheim three times and each time has been a great experience.   The staff have always been very friendly and accommodating. The room and hotel have been very clean and comfortable.   The hotel has a nice cozy feeling with the fireplace, sofa and TV in the lobby. A nice touch is the coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning, and the water and cookies in the evening.  It is far enough from Disneyland that you get away from the madness, but close enough that it's a quick ride with the shuttle.   It's nice to have the fridge and microwave in the room. The Target is across the street so you can easily pick up a few supplies for quick meals and snacks.  The elevator could use a little maintenance, but nothing serious.   There is a shuttle
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn this weekend (May 2012).  Check in was quick and the desk staff helpful and friendly.  Hilton Honors guests get a free bottle of water.  Room was average, on the order of a HI.  Dial a number bed and a freshly washed duvet, nice touch!  Repairs and painting were handled.  Carpeting, though not threadbare, is ready for new padding...there were carpet nails to be felt between the bath tile and entry.  Overall, a good value near the parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was overall really great. What stood out the most for me was the staff, they were very helpful and pleasant! The rooms were clean and spacious, beds were really comfy. The only problem we had with our room was that the bathroom toilet was leaking, but within minutes the maintenance guy came and it was fixed. Breakfast was good, but you had to pay extra for it. There were two options, either $8,95 or so for the cold buffet or $12,95 for the hot and cold buffet. I personnaly thought the cheaper option was plenty (bagels, toast, pastries, yogurt, fruit, cereal, coffee....) but my boyfriend enjoyed the hot breakfast (french toast and omelette with bacon and sausage). The spa was small but nice and clean. We used it almost every evening and found it relaxing. The hotel is
Manager Response: It is always a wonderful thing when we exceed our guests expectations! Thank you for the great comments about our helpful staff and very descriptive breakdown of the hotel amenities and tasty breakfast. Next time please check with our Front Desk team who will be happy to give some wonderful dinner suggestions within walking distance and great local attraction that are just a short way from the hotel. We look forward to having you back in the future!

Summary: We stayed here 10 days in April 2012. Hotel was clean, breakfast was good (lots of fresh fruit, oatmeal, cold cereal, pancakes, eggs...), staff was fairly nice. We have a 1 year old daughter and there wasn't much for her to do, except going to Disneyland, of course. But if you are not planning in going there EVERYDAY while you're staying here, consider bringing plenty of toys and activities for the little ones. All there is for them in the neighborhood is a tiny playground a couple of miles away from the hotel.
Manager Response: We are glad that the accomodations were ideal for a Disney trip, including clean accomodations, location, and a tasty breakfast. We always strive to be exceptional in service, so want to make sure the next time we change that fairly around! If you are lounging around the hotel we do always have the heated pool, whirlpool, business center, exercise room, and just in case you need them we do carry games for free at the front desk! Also, our Front Desk staff would be happy to make some suggestions on area attractions and cost effective transportation to and from those.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay on Harbor Blvd
Summary: Stayed here last week. Room was clean, bed was comfy. Exercise room is small, but adequate and staff is always super-helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you writing the short, but sweet, review on the hotel. The number of great comments we have had on our service have been extraordinary! It is also, of course, great to hear positive things about our cleaniness and amentiies!

Summary Heading: Switched From My Conference Hotel to Remain in This One!
Summary: I ended up booking here for one night because I couldn't get into the hotel where my conference was being held.  As it turned out, this hotel was cleaner and a better value so I switched my reservation and remained here for nearly a week. It had an awesome breakfast and some of the nicest desk staff that I have ever encountered.  The bed was super-comfortable and the location was great for my needs. I was a very long way from home, but I certainly didn't feel so far away thanks to these people,  I would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: This is an amazing review! To know that we wowed you to the point that you truly went out of your way to stay with us, makes me incredibly proud! Thank you for the glowing review and we look forward to having you back in the future!

Summary Heading: Superb Hotel, Very Friendly Staff and Great Location!
Summary: This was my third business visit to to Southern California. I stayed at this Hotel in September 2011. For novices, Hilton has many categories of hotels and this is not a 100-storey types but one of their mid-priced hotels. However, that is not to be misconstrued as lack of service or facilities. Location is very close to Disneyland. Target, Subway, Pharmacy, other restaurants are very nearby.  Right from the reception to end of stay, I was thoroughly impressed. Room was very spacious and neatly done. Internet was complimentary for everybody. Room also had a fridge and microwave which was a big plus. Room service was responsive and amenities were ample.  Parking was chargeable but being a HHonors member, they made some provisions for it. Being a HHonors member, I was provided
Manager Response: Thank you so much for pointing out all of the great things about our hotel! Our location, how we work within the Hilton family of hotels, our convenient amenities and services, as well as our friendly, welcoming staff. Next time I hope you have time to try the breakfast, I assure you it is delicious!

Summary: Thanks to the hotel staff it was a real good place to stay as we were attending Disneyland the shuttle was near and so were fast food places and target etc. I would stay there again and would tell others to stay there as well.
Manager Response: It is so nice to receive yet another response that discusses our hardworking, friendly staff and great location! Thank you so much for the taking the time to let others know!

Summary: We are a family of 4 and recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, Anaheim for 3 nights.  We were visiting CSU Long Beach and Disneyland.  The rooms are spacious and very clean.  The beds were comfortable as well.  There is a microwave and refrigerator in the room, which came in handy.    The heater/ac unit wasn't working when we checked in, but a call to the front desk and it was fixed within 20 minutes.  We did not use the pool or exercise room, but they looked very nice.    Buca di Beppa is within walking distance.  We are HH gold members and get breakfast for 2 included with our membership.  When we checked in, the clerk saw that we are a family of 4 and gave us breakfast vouchers for all 4 of us staying in the hotel.    The breakfast was wonderful.  Everything was fresh and
Manager Response: Thank you for letting others know about our well appointed rooms and friendly staff. Although we strive to have all guest stays incident free, it is good to know that the issue with your heater-A/C was quickly fixed! I would also like to point out that yes it can be a long walk to the hotel after a long day at Disneyland, but we do offer transportation to and from the parks that picks up curbside for a minimal fee. Thanks again for your stay and we look forward to having you back!

Summary: This hotel was phenomenal in accommodating my need to stay on a day-by-day basis.  We needed a place to bring my college-aged daughter to recuperate after emergency surgery in Orange.  Granted, this wasn't the peak season, though it was spring break time, the front desk help assured me we could stay however long we needed and wouldn't have to move rooms nor be charged penalty for leaving without 24 hour notice.  Thank you, Hassan!  Every staff member at this establishment was beyond pleasant and helpful.  Many took interest in my daughter's health, always asking if there was anything I needed.   The rooms are quite spacious, with a perfect little "kitchen" corner with refrigerator, microwave, cabinets and coffee maker.  Everything worked well and the space was perfect for the
Manager Response: I am so glad that you enjoyed your stay here with us. We take great pride in our service, accomodations, location, and amenities, and it seems that we were able to impress on all accounts. All of us appreciate you taking the time and would like to wish your daughter a speedy recovery!

Summary: I and a family member stayed at this property for 3 days on family business and found it to be a delightful property with attentive staff. the rooms were spacious and clean, and all appliances worked well. The breakfast buffet was very good with very attentive waite staff.  On site parking was ample. The property is conveniently located, and quiet even though near a major interstate highway. Within 5 minutes driving are a variety of wonderful restaurants.
Manager Response: There is nothing I love more than hearing and seeing posts about our great property. From everything from the service, the rooms, the food, and the location it seems that we had everything you needed! We all look forard to seeing you again when you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area!

Summary Heading: I really like the feel of this hotel
Summary: I really like the feel of this hotel. Its very comfortable. As soon as i walked in the room i felt like home. I just had a problem with the gym not working and no one let me know that the gym was not working when checking in the hotel. So i had to check out and go to embassy suites right behind them. And also the bed was a little hard on my husbands back, i don't know if i was suppose to - or i didn't understand the kind of adjustments to put on the bed because of the adjustable beds here. So my husband didn't sleep well on his bed but i slept ok in the other bed i slept on with my daughter. The room was clean and they have breakfast in the morning. I didn't get to try that because by that time i was moving hotel because of gym situation. But the employees in front desk of
Manager Response: Thank you for commending the team for their service. We are sorry you experieinced issues during your stay, but the good news is that the issues are easy to fix and explain. I am happy to tell you that theexercise room is now fully operational again! Also, our Garden Sleep System beds, though generally loved, can be a bit confusing. Please allow us the opportunity to explain the system next time you are in town, I assure you once you get it set to your liking you will definately get a great nights sleep!

Summary: Recently stayed there for business.   Breakfast Service A+.   Entire Staff has a can do attitude right down to the maid
Manager Response: We take great pride in our little family community here at the HGI! Thank you so much for noticing and letting others know!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We had a very nice time at this hotel.  Mr. Torres was very welcoming and friendly when we checked in and the service at breakfast was also good.  The bed was comfortable and room was very clean.   We did pay a high price for the room so I took off a star for that.  Even when we checked in he seemed surprised at our rate mentioning it was really high and asked if we were here for the convention (which we were not).   The breakfast was great but the only little thing is the coffee is scalding.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us and very pleased with the hospitable service we were able to provide (especially Mr. Torres). I am sorry about the rate! There are a handful of large conferences that come to the area throughout the year which creates a tremendous amount of demand in the area, thus the higher rates everywhere! I have spoken to our restaurant to ensure water temperature for the coffee is at an ideal level. We are glad you will be back and look forward to meeting you!

Summary Heading: nice hotel in greater Los Angeles
Summary: We stayed three nights in this hotel and can recommend it to you. It is a few blocks from  Disneyland, and happy families wearing mickey mouse ears are not uncommon, though we, as senior citizens to be, were not bothered by children. The hotel offers an outside swimming pool as well as a gym. For dinner you have to go to one of the numerous restaurants within walking distance, or order room service. The crew, from front desk to breakfast servants, were very helpful, and supplied us with printed directions to shopping malls and restaurants. The rooms were spacious, with a desk+ deskchair as well as an easy chair. The rooms were clean, but some noise from the 2*3 lanes road in front of the hotel was audible.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your recomendation to others about your great stay and helpful service  that was provided during your visit with us! Inevitably you will see a Mickey ear or two, but we do take great pride in being a little quieter than the majority of the hotels in the area. The issue with the street noise is something we rarely hear, but for the light sleepers the west side of the hotel is facing away from the street. Thanks again for your comments and we hope to see you here soon!

Summary Heading: Very good, well-priced hotel with good location
Summary: I recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in Garden Grove on a business trip.  The Hilton provided a nice comfortable place to stay while travelling on business without costing an arm and a leg.    The Hilton Garden Inn is well-located just over a mile from the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland.  There is ample easy parking off of a short side street which intersects the main street, Harbor Boulevard with a traffic signal allowing easy entry/exit.    The lobby is spacious, bright, and clean.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  Housekeeping tidied up my room perfectly each day making it a welcome place to end a work day.  Internet service was reliable and fast, both wired and wireless.   The ergo' chair at the work table was a very nice touch.  The reading chair
Manager Response: I truly appreciate the very descriptive analysis of our hotel and the fact that you pointed our areas that are sometimes overlooked, such as the bright rooms, airy lobby, and quiet rooms. It never hurts to hear that our service and cleanliess are great as well! I do feel that our hotel is also well equipped for families, with our comfortable beds, quiet atmosphere,  and kids eat free breakfast (one per paying adult), as well as our Disneyland Good Neighbor status which allows us the opportunity to sell discount tickets to the park, we are an ideal choice for families. Thank you again for your kind comments and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary Heading: The best buffet breakfast in the area - looking forward to the new restaurant in May!
Summary: The staff at this hotel are outstanding from front desk to food and beverage.  There are some issues that we had (the weird sleep number bed was broken and unable to be fixed at 3:00am) which were addressed the next day.  Having to sleep on essentially a flat air bed was not the highlight of my stay - but spending time in the hot tub helped to remedy my aching back the next day.  Another issue is the overwhelming use of some noxious smelling disinfectanct "air freshener" spray by the housekeeping staff.  I literally had to hold my breath on the way to the room as the smell in the hall would kill a canary.  One wonders what necesitated the overspraying to begin with... Still, I was grateful that the bedroom window was able to open about 6 inches which allowed the room to get some
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments about our tasty breakfast. I agree that our waffles are great! We also run daily specials, I personally love the breakfast burrito with the freshly made salsa, I promise it is quite good! I have discussed the the air freshener and issues that you had with our Garden Sleep System bedding. We are looking at modifying the usage of the air freshener and have audited all beds to ensure the air baffles are working properly. We look forward to your return and when you come in please stop by and say hello!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night Feb 15. The rooms are a little dated but the staff were so accommodating and helpful. The young lady that checked us in was the most helpful front desk person we encountered on our whole USA trip. Nothing was too hard for her to help us with. Shuttle bus made it easy to get to and from Disneyland and the cookies and coffee at night was a nice touch. Room was clean with a fridge and microwave.
Manager Response: Thank you for commenting about your recent stay with us! I am not sure where all of your travels took you, but we are proud we were able to provide the best service that you encountered! We hope to have you back again as our guest next time you travel out this way.

Summary: We stayed in this hotel  from 4th to 9th Jan as a part of our disney trip. I must say that we had a great experience.. great morning breakfast to start the day and when we use to come from our disneyland - we always found our rooms were clean, tidyup.. :)  Staff : excellent , very helpful. They can organize trip of hollywood, seaworld, universal studio, legoland etc.. just ask them...  Pool -- we didnt got much time to spend in the pool(except for couple hours) as we were so busy touring disneyland. But whatever time my kids spent there.. they loved it..  NOTE TO DISNEY VISITOR:  The shuttle bus goes from hotel every 0 and 30 mins.. which is awesome .. and its very reasonably priced plus you can go back and forth to disneyland as many times during the day (from 8 am to 1 am)..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking to time to let others know about your great stay with us. We take great pride in our accomodations, food, and of course the fact that all of our associates are always ready to help out our guests with any kind of concierge needs that they may have! I like the advise to everyone to hold onto your hats and glasses (and in your case pictures), it is really unfortunate to lose those important momentos! Thanks again for the great comments and we look forward to having you back in the future.

Summary Heading: Not as nice as most Hilton Garden Inns. This one is more like a Hampton.
Summary: The hotel is in a superb location for Disney goers. The staff is very friendly. However the hotel rooms were not the best. Worned out faded carpet, spots on the walls and bathroom floor, a filthy ironing board cover and a comforter on the bed that smelled like someone else had just used it (body odor) is not the Hilton standard. The"fitness center" has 2 treadmills and one elliptical machine in a cramped space. Since there are six floors you would expect a bigger fitness area and a few more machines.  I tried to get a workout in morning and evening to no avail. I was on a business trip so Disney was not on my agenda. Prior to this stay I spent 3 nights at another Hilton Garden Inn in another part of the state that could run circles around this dump.  The bottom line is it is
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for the issues that occured during your stay with us. We take a great deal of pride in our accomodations and cleanliness and assure you that I have discussed your response with the management team. We have since inspected all rooms to ensure ironing boards are perfect, and we are also working to determine the room you had issues with the carpet. We would love to have you back as our guest! Please feel free to contact me at 714.703.9100 or email me at keith.moses@hilton.com.

Summary Heading: Say Hello To Our New Found Little Gem Of A Hotel!!!
Summary: This review is long overdue but i wanted to make sure that i put in my $.02-cents worth of an opinion on our new favorite Hotel in the Disney area. My wife and i were traveling on our 12th Annual Disneyland trip with our extended family. They all stayed elsewhere but my wife and i made the best choice ever by staying at the Hilton Garden Inn this year. Our check in date was Sunday 11/27/11 and we were literally met at the front door of the Hotel by Front Desk Associate Mark M. who had graciously grabbed a luggage carrier-cart for us. Mark's cheerful demeanor and assistance was greatly appreciated after our long road trip ( + his brilliant smile and movie-star good looks was all just a bonus as well!) Have you ever just met someone and you imediately "click" and know that they're
Manager Response: Wow, what a fantastic review and experience you had with us! Reading comments such as yours make me truly realize how blessed I am to have the amazing team I have the privilege to work with every day! Next time you are in please take a moment to say hello so I may have the opportunity to thank you in person for such a wonderful review of our hotel!

Summary: We went to Disneyland for the holidays and stayed in Hilton Garden Inn for 3 nights. It wasnt a big hotel but it was the best hotel we stayed in Anaheim. The value was perfect and the amenities met my familes needs. The bed was so comfortable and fridge /microwave in the room helps a lot. They even have free neutrogena toiletries in the bathroom. The room is always clean everytime we come back from the park. ART station is just across the hotel which is very convinient. The hotel even offer free cookies at night and coffee/ tea in the lobby. We would stay at Hilton Garden Inn again!!!
Manager Response: You really covered it all in your synopsis of the hotel, breaking out all of the amenities and services we provide. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and I hope to meet you personally on your next visit!

Summary: I am writing this review having just checked out and had yet another great stay at this hotel. I have reviewed this hotel before and have stayed here many times over the last 11 years and is always my choice of hotel for this area. but after reading the negative review a few back just thought I'd add my recent thoughts. It's a really friendly hotel the staff are exceptional especially the breakfast staff, they are really lovely. The hotel is clean and well maintained although we actually had problems with our toilet not working properly but it was dealt with and they even left a gift in our room to say sorry and bought us breakfast. Location is great and parking has never been a problem, all in all it's a great choice for this area it's also a little quieter than the hotels
Manager Response: I want to thank you for your amazing loyalty! 11 years in a row staying us, wow you have been with us since the beginning! Thank you for the great comments about the team and the cleanliness of the rooms, most notably the kind comments about our tasty food and service in  breakfast. We can't allow the cook to go home with our guests, otherwise we wouldn't have anyone to cook the exceptional breakfasts for all of our future guests!

Summary Heading: Great Location Nice Staff Good Breakfast
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn this year while we visited Disneyland for Thanksgiving. The check-in was speedy, the staff was really friendly to my family and the breakfast was great and filling. I was so pleased to know we could get a hot filling meal to order instead of just juice and muffins as many hotels serve for breakfast.  The cook even remade an omlet for me when it tasted funny. I felt terrible about it and was not going to say anything but our server insisted on making it right. I really didn't want to make a big deal out of it. I was glad they took good care of us at breakfast.  The room was basic and very clean. It wasn't anything overly fancy and had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable and had some sort of adjustment system that we couldn't
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your stay with us! We are glad our team was able to provide the kind of service that would warrant such kind words from our guests. Since your review I have addressed the cleanliness issue with the shuttle company that provides the transportation and they have fully detailed and cleaned the bus and we setup a monthly audit of the bus to ensure it stays clean for our future guests.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn over the Thanksgiving holiday.  The room was very clean and comfortable, and the hotel staff very friendly and accommodating.  Although the hotel was obviously very full with guests, we did not hear noise at night in the hallway while sleeping.  I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning how quiet our hotel is, even during the high leisure rush times! We take great pride in being able to offer a nice quiet, relaxing stay to all of our guests, even with Disneyland being less than a mile away!

Summary: I stayed here one night with my son during a recent visit to Disneyland.  This property is pretty dated, but it's located a short (driving) distance from Disney.  The bathrooms and hallways are generally old.  But the room was quiet - we had good quality sleep (which is the most important to me).  The service in the restaurant for breakfast was very good and the check-in process was fast.
Manager Response: We are glad that you had a good nights rest on our specially made sleep system bedding and that the service we provided was very good. Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about how we are doing.

Summary: Unclean, smelly public areas, bubble gum smelling hallways like i had not smelled them in the last 30 Years! No service of any kind, no bar, no restaurant, no movies in the room. The 1970's in-room heater unit (!!!!) makes noises like a locomotive. The pantry looks like a supermarket in the Soviet Union in the 80's. Really an embarassement to the Hilton name!! I am sure Paris never stayed here!!
Manager Response: The response you have posted is most troubleing to me and I apologize for the impression that we left with you. As you can see by the majority other postings, we take great pride in our service and accomodations, so your particular stay and impression is not indicitive of the culture we have set at our property. I am researching the comments made, I have never heard or witnessed a bubble gum smell and the heating/AC units all function from a wall thermostat and the majority of the units have been replaced within the last four years. Please feel free to give me a call or email me so I may have the opportunity to discuss these issues with you in further detail. I can be reached at 714.703.9100 or by emailing keith.moses@hilton.com.

Summary: I never take the time to write a review on a hotel, but this hotel stay was absolutely perfect!!  It was our annual trip to Disneyland with our three kids (9, 6, and 4) and our friend's son, who's also 9.  The hotel was clean, beds were comfortable, and service was superb!  The front desk staff were all friendly everyday!  The restaurant staff were very helpful and courteous!!  We liked it so much, we ate there every morning!  We stayed 4 nights.  The food was good, not to mention, we took advantage of the kids eat free...3 kids eat free per adult...that was awesome on a Disney budget.  It was just a great way to start each day!!  All you can eat for adults.  The little weight room was reallly nice too!  'Wish we could've made more time to dip our feet in the spa, but time did
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful comments and noting all the little things we are doing right, such as the linen origami, supplying the quiet rooms, tasty food, and so on. It make me so happy to hear that we were able to be a part of your Disney experience!

Summary Heading: Too Far to Walk, Too Close to Drive
Summary: I stayed here for BlizzCon 2011. While the property itself is a good bargain, clean, and comfortable, people should be aware of the location.   I am from New York City and spend most of my time walking, but the property is actually in an uncomfortable zone between "too far to walk, too close to drive." The Anaheim Convention Center (and Disneyland) are both within walking distance in the morning after a cup of coffee, but when you are coming home late after a long day at a theme park and/or carrying a bunch of stuff from a convention, the walk becomes very, very long. However, driving to either of those properties seems like a waste of gas (and makes one feel a little lazy.) On the other hand, it might be nice to stay away from the chaos of downtown disney and all the packed
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just got back from the Anaheim area last night and I promised myself that I would write a review for this hotel.   First off, every staff member was VERY friendly and accommodating. They took care of our every need and always greeted us with a smile. Genuinely pleasant people and it was much appreciated.   Second, the rooms were quite nice. Nothing fancy, but very clean and the beds are comfy. The blackout curtains kept the light out and the room was neither too hot, nor too cold (we kept the thermostat between 70-73, I think). We also had a fridge and microwave which was great for having breakfast in the morning while we were getting ready for the day. We had requested a quiet room on an upper floor and I must say I slept better here than I've slept in most hotels in my life. I
Manager Response: I truly appreciate you taking the time to let us know of your great stay with us! I have been reading through a number of different reviews and it is great to see (for the most part) a general consensus with what you said; that we offer great service, comfortable beds, quiet rooms, and a reasonable price. All the cornerstones of a great stay! Again thank you for letting us know about your experience with us!

Summary: We were here for 5 days and were grateful that we spent most of our time out of the hotel.  The bathrooms smelt like mold.  The hotel in general did not smell good.  The rooms were very large and had a large closet, but no storage in the bathroom and the drawers in the room were small and smelled old and dusty.  The beds were very comfortable, but the sheets had tears in it, and the comforter was scratchy on top.  The extra blankets felt like sand paper, they smelt clean though.  The fridge was convenient, but small, we had to put our milk on it's side to fit it in.  We ended up using our cooler to carry half of the food.  The bathtub plug was very difficult to plug, it kept popping up and had a slow leak so we had to refill the tub every few minutes.  The bathroom drain was
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear about the issues you had during your stay with us! Please know that we take great pride in our service and amenities, so when we fall short of the high standards we have set for ourselves, it is always a disappointment. I have reviewed your posting with the management team and have addressed the issues mentioned. If you get a moment to contact me direcltly so I may have the opportunity to investigate the specific room and try to make this up to you it would be greatly appreciated. You may reach me at keith.moses@hilton.com or by dialing 714.620.2137.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Experience For A Reasonable Price
Summary: Just stayed here Sept 28 - Oct 2 with my wife and daughter and was very pleasantly surprised by my experience here. The room was clean, spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. The staff was very attentive and friendly, including the front desk people who were always smiling and helpful and the waiter for breakfast who was cheerful and friendly. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced with the coupon where adults paid $10 and kids ate free. The hotel had a shuttle every half hour to and from Disney (cost $10 per day for 2 adults and 1 child) which made going to and from Disney very convenient. The hotel was in walking distance to several restaurants (i.e. Buco Di Pepo, Outbacks, Joe's Crab Shack, etc.) as well as being convenient to Target and Walgreens if you need
Manager Response: Thank you so much for pointing out all that the hotel has to offer, including the great service, comfortable beds, tasty breakfast, and all that the surrounding area has to offer. All at a reasonable price. We look forward to having you back int he future!

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff and comfortable bed - highly recommend
Summary: My family stayed here from Sep. 2 to 7 recently.  We arrived at hotel around 10:00 pm.  We were so tired after long travel.  When we were walking towards front desk to check-in, the front desk staff had a big smile and greeted us so pleasantly that we almost forgot how tired we were.. He waved at our kids and carried himself professionally.  He made us feel very welcomed.  I should have got his name.   The bed was very comfortable and clean.  We have stayed at 5 star hotels and never had this kind of comfortable bed.  It was worth it after spending all day walking at disneyland.  Hotel breakfast was nothing special but all I can remember was that friendly front desk staff who checked us in on the night of Sep. 2, 2011.   Having the microwave and fridge was helpful when we
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for mentioning our Garden Sleep System beds. I agree, it is nice to be able to choose your own comfort level, whether it be firm or soft. Also, we pride ourselves in our service and it seems to have impacted your stay!

Summary Heading: Perfect stay; loved this hotel for Disney - also good for convention center
Summary: We stayed for a trip to Disney.  Some of other guests were there for Disney also, and the rest were business travellers.  Note that we didn't really like this part of town and would only stay here for a specific local attraction, such as Disney or the convention center.  There are local restaurants catering to families ... Denny's, a bakery and cafe with large pictures all over a plastic menu, Buca Di Beppo in the parking lot and others.  Otherwise, the businesses seem mostly local and have large iron bars across the front windows and doors at night.  But back to our trip ... it was perfect.  We stayed for two nights.  The first day we spent at Disney, and the 2nd day we went sightseeing in the morning, begged for a late checkout and took a nap, and then headed to the airport
Manager Response: There is nothing I enjoy more then hearing that you had a perfect stay while you were with us! Thank you for pointing out the long list of our wonderful pluses. I am glad to see the minuses were far outweighed! We look forward to having you back in the future.

Summary Heading: Average at best - room worn and poorly maintained
Summary: I recently stayed here with a family of four.  I have previously stayed at about ten different hotels in the area.  I like Hilton Garden Inns and have stayed at a handful across the US.  This one was disappointing.  The staff, of course, is polite and professional.  Very nice folks.  On the flip side, our room had issues.  The faucet in the tub dripped (about 2 drips a second) non-stop.  The anti-slip flooring in the bottom of the tub was about half worn off.  The toilet had been replaced recently and was brand new - but the old caulk was still on the tile showing the outline of the old toilet - and the seat bolts were loose (real loose - as though it was installed and someone forgot to tighten them at all - I turned it by hand about 12 turns to get it moderately tight).  The
Manager Response: We take great pride in both our service and accomdations, I am terribly sorry that we fell short for you on the accomodations side. I assure you the issues you had were an anomoly and by no means the norm. I wish we had the opportunity to make things better prior to your departure. Please feel free to contact me at 714.620.2137 or via email at keith.moses@hilton.com. so we may discuss in more detail. Thanks!

Summary: Economical choice near Irvine. Many restaurants near by; breakfast on site, or good choices are also nearby. Wanted the Hilton Anaheim, it was sold out. This was a very good alternate in the vicinity.
Manager Response: When you do come back please make sure to drop in to say hello! Thank you.

Summary Heading: Great spot for business travelers near Disney
Summary: Some hotels can be overly rambunctious being so close to Disneyland with excited families on vacation. Which is fantastic. But if you are a light sleeper, or a business traveler looking for a little more peace and quiet then this hotel is a good option.  If you want something a little more rambunctious take a look at the Hampton Inn located in the same parking lot. Not quite as updated as this hotel, but okay.   The rooms here are very clean and kept up very well. They are big and spacious and you will find a microwave, coffee maker, and small fridge. Unfortunately the refrigerator has a tiny freezer section, not good for me because I try to eat out as little as possible so I pick up TV dinners and such for my longer stays in hotels.    No free breakfast here, but you can find a
Manager Response: I really appreciate you mentioning the fact that we are little quieter then the norm when coming to the Anaheim area. We take pride in the fact that after a long day of work or fun, it is nice to come back to a nice, clean, quiet environment. Although there is a fee for the breakfast, there are different rate programs such as our Bed and Breakfast rate that allows you to enjoy it at a discount and it is just added right into your rate. One thing to say, is that the breakfast is quite tasty! Thanks.

Summary: Prior to booking with the Hilton Garden Inn, I did an extensive search through the TA website, as I always do. I searched for a property that would provide a good value for the money, without having to resort to your typical 2* motel. I settled with the Hilton after finding a great rate through getawaytoday. The rate was terrific (under $90 after tax with free parking for a weekend, end of July). The reviews on TA were very positive. And it also had 2 Queen beds, a requirement for my search to give a bit more of comfort for our family of four. I should say that I am more than satisfied with the choice. It fitted the bill, and I can really think of anything negative to say about it.  First, I should note that our rate did not include breakfast or the shuttle to Disneyland (but
Manager Response: What a well thought out, elaborate posting about just about everything we provide! Thank you so much for taking the time. The only thing that  was odd is that you did not have an alarm clock in the room? We actually have specially designed AM/FM/MP3 digital alarm clocks in all guest rooms (in fact the sound is pretty great for an alarm clock!). We will conduct an audit of the hotel to ensure all rooms are properly furnished with this great amenity.  Thank you again for your time!

Summary: When ever I am down in the Anaheim area and especially when I go to Disneyland, there is no other place I will stay then this fab gem of a hotel!  Why do you ask?  It's a great hotel, but the staff are what makes my stays over the top.  And they always remember what kind of room I like!  Keith the General Manager, Seth, Jeannette, Huson and all the staff always are so nice and has a "what ever I need" attitude!!  They have an excellent staff in the restrauant, where you can order a "Full Cook To Order" breakfast!  You can walk to Disneyland from the hotel or take the shuttle.  Yeah you can stay right across the street form Disneyland, but you will not find as nice a staff and a hotel.  There is something to be said for the Hilton Chains.  They know how to give good service!  So
Manager Response: Your loyalty and comments are incredible! We know that when in this area there are a more then a lot of choices, so we do everything in our power to make sure that the service shine through. Thank you so much for your comments, I will enjoy sharing them with the team!

Summary Heading: What a Great Hotel - would totally stay here again!
Summary: This hotel was worth the money we paid for it. From check-in to check-out the staff made us at home right away. Kudos specifically to Mark, who checked us in. He was very nice and very familiar with the area. He pointed out points of interest, and places to eat.  The room was located on the 2nd floor. The hotel was also very quiet - I got a restful night sleep every night with no interruption. The room was also very clean and the linens were changed, even though I did not request it.   It's proximity to Disneyland and it's great value made us choose this hotel, and if we were ever to visit the area again, we would definitely choose this one! Also - check out the shuttle if you do not want to drive to Disneyland - it was $4 roundtrip per person (DL parking is $15) and they drop
Manager Response: We would love to have you again! There is nothing better then when someone provides the kind of service that you remember them by name, and it seems that we had one who was able to do that! I assure you, your kind words will be passed onto the team and that particular employee!

Summary: We stayed here for 13 nights,as our family holiday from Scotland. We were very impressed by all the staff at the hotel. What a really fine bunch of people from management through to the service staff. Very friendly and always helpful, something many hotels in the UK could learn from!!  Room size was fine for us (Couple + teenager) and it was nice to have the fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Rooms were always clean and tidy. Nothing was  a problem to the staff.  Pool was fine and hot tub was a nice treat. Gym is small, but there is enough space to house the running and Nordic Ski machines. We gave the gym a miss as the walking around the theme parks was exercise enough!  Breakfast was standard, but was very nice. Plenty for any one. My wife is vegetarian and never struggled
Manager Response: Wow, that really means a lot to know that we contributed to changing your view on the entire US! You really said it all in your email and we look forward to your return (I really hope you are a fan of beans and toast!).

Summary: Hotel is conveniently close to Disney parks, sells Disney tickets on-site at a discount, and has a shuttle available every half hour.  The staff was very friendly, helpful, and went the extra mile to accommodate our adjoining room request, and parking needs.  The breakfast buffet was terrific with an excellent variety of fresh food.  They made our eggs, waffles, pancakes perfectly to order.  The server always remembered our preferences (party of 8) and quickly had our coffee/ tea at our table.  The hotel had a Family Fun package that we took and it was worth every penny.  The pool, hot tub, fitness center, and being walking distance to many family restaurants was the icing on the cake.
Manager Response: I love that you are spreading the good word about us being a great family hotel. At times people think we are more of a corporate hotel, but we take pride in the fact that we are able to provide the best service and amenities in town (albeit, I am a bit biased).

Summary: The hotel staff from front desk to housekeeping is friendly, professional and hard working. The room size is standard but  was clean, well kept and has all the amenities that made our stay very comfortable and enjoyable.  It has flat screen TV, refrigerator, microwave....complimentary internet....etc.... We will definitely be back in the near future.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for letting us know about your stay, I especially love hearing great comments  about  our hard working staff. I look forward to having you back, please make sure to stop by the desk to say hi!

Summary: The Hilton is close to Disneyland and even a Target. The hotel staff was wonderful. I really liked that the clean room came with a small fridge and microwave. When we came in at night, there were warm cookies to eat before we went to the hot tub.
Manager Response: Thank you for the short, but sweet comments about your stay with us. Warm cookies and a hot tub sound sure do sound pretty good after a long day!

Summary: Business stay for two nights.  Room was the typical Hilton Garden Inn (not fancy, they are all nearly the same).  We did accidentally book through Expedia, so they would not honor my HHonors Diamond benefits, which was very disappointing (they said that we could 'call' Hilton for this).   Hotel did allow us to check our one hour late, which was nice.   Internet speed was better than most other Hilton hotels (which is still slow, but better than others).
Manager Response: We are glad you noticed the speed of our internet! We recently upgraded the connection speed and I have really enjoyed the impact it has had for all of our tech friendly guests. I am sorry about the inability to reward Hhonors points for your Expedia stay and I am hoping that at some time in the near future a solution may be found to address this issue. Thank you for letting us know your thoughts and pointing out the consistency withen the HGI brand.

Summary Heading: Best Hilton Property for the Money
Summary: We have stayed at all three hilton properties located on the same property in  Garden Grove.  Every year when our family visits Disney, we stay at one of the three properties, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton Inn, or Embassy Suites.  The Embassy Suites has raised their price, therefore in order to save money we have been staying at the other two properties more often.  With the advance payment option, at Hilton Garden Inn we are able to have breakfast included at a substantial savings, and since this property has table service, it is the best breakfast of the three.  It is also less crowded than the other two, and easier to park in their parking lot.  We used their shuttle one day that comes every one half hour, but really preferred the one that stops in front of Embassy Suites, since
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to respond. We take great pride in our breakfast and the fact that it is not the madhouse that it tends to be at some of the other locations in the area. I hope you were able to try the daily specials we offer, they are all made from scratch (our salsa is quite tasty!).We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Only stayed for one night but was completely satisfied.  Excellent rate, good service, good location, nice hotel.  Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for the short, but sweet comments. It is wonderful to know the great impact we had when you were only with us for one night!

Summary: This place is located within a ring of several hotels. We stayed for four nights while we visited Disneyland, California Adventure, and Universal Studios.  We upgraded our stay to include breakfast in the morning, which was totally worth it.  The selection was great, the staff friendly, and we saved time and money by eating at the hotel.  Also, the place sells shuttle passes, so we were able to take a shuttle (runs every half hour) to and from Disneyland/California Adventure.  For our family of four (three at adult price and one child) the cost was $14. Though only one dollar cheaper than the Disney parking lot, the convenience was well worth it, and the shuttle stop is much closer to the park than the parking lot.  The hotel's fitness center is minimal but sufficient; the best
Manager Response: It sounds like we had everything you needed to make your stay with us comfortable and enjoyable.We appreciate the comments on riendly staff and amenities. Thank you for pointing out the infused water, it is quite refreshing on a hot summer day! We look forward to having your back next time you are in the area.

Summary: I have stayed at this property numerous times when in the area on business - and even check in again tomorrow for five nights.  This property has always been excellent, with very friendly staff.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your loyalty to us, we truly appreciate it! We realize you have a lot of option when in the Anaheim area, so we cannot thank you enough for choosing us. Next time you are in please drop by the desk to say hello.

Summary Heading: Haven't been there yet, but will be in 8 days
Summary: Booked a hotel room here yesterday and thought I would re some reviews to ensure we made the right decision.  Looking forward to it.
Manager Response: I must admit that this is a first to be reviewed before getting here, it really shows the power of Trip Advisor! At this point your stay has come and gone and we all really hope you that enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: Really a good, convenient hotel for our annual family reunion. The rooms were clean, quiet and well equipped. Shuttle service was excellent, on-time and reliable. We liked the breakfast downstairs. Location is walkable to Joe's Crab Shack, and Outback, a definite plus. Staff was helpful, allowed our elderly parents a very late checkout and brought my stuff down to the front desk and held it for me when we were delayed at Disneyland. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There was nothing spectacular about this hotel, it was just average.  Everything was clean which is important.    We were staying for a trip to disneyland.  We booked 4 rooms for 4 nights through Priceline, which i find to be the best deals when planning a disneyland trip.  At the time, the front desk wasn't good at providing information so we didn't realize we had to pay for the shuttle to Disneyland each day.  That isn't a problem, except we had to get tickets from the front desk so it would have been nice if we were told that upfront.    The last day we all decided to eat  in the dining room there at the hotel.  The food was horrible.  Scrambled eggs were cold and hard, the pancakes cold and harder than the eggs, everything was mediocre at best..  The waitress in there was
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Garden Grove near Anaheim. Just a short drive from Disneyland! The front desk was very friendly. The rooms were clean (a little mold in the shower) and were equipped with microwaves and small fridges. This was good for storing orange juice and other breakfast items. The hotel does have a breakfast buffet for around $9.95/ea. We never tried it but it smelled good! They also have room service.The hotel has a nice pool area (too cold for it unfortunately) and a gym. In vicinity to the hotel is a Buca di Beppo which is good for a dinner. It is also near the GardenWalk (I think it is called) which has restaurants and shops. A Target is close by for necessities you may have forgot at home. I saw other families staying here and would
Manager Response: none

Summary: We needed Super Glue for a temporary fix for our Granddaughters eye glasses. Not knowing our way around the area and had no car, the general manager actually jumped into his car and went to the store and purchased for us. He was back before our group was scheduled to leave for the Park. He saved our day!  Shuttle service is convenient to the Park, clean comfortable rooms, good breakfast and cold flavored (lemon and orange) water available in the lobby.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words about the hotel and the super glue incident! I am always happy to save someones day (especially if it is a kid going to Disneyland!). Thank you for choosing us and we look forward to having you back in the future.

Summary Heading: Hilton Garden is a great place to stay with nice clean rooms and great friendly staff.
Summary: I was impressed with their nice clean suites, super nice staff and their proximity to a variety of nice restaurants. The kids loved the pool and the cookies they provided in the evening.
Manager Response: Based on your response, it sounds like we had everything you needed! Thank you for taking the time to let us (and everyone else) know!

Summary: We have stayed at this HGI several times. As in the past we found the staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. It was also super quiet. However, the downside the parking is terrible. People are parking all along the curb including the no parking area. In our previous stays at this HGI we were evacuated twice due to the fire alarms going off. If the fire department had to respond this time they would have had a problem  pulling into the parking lot . When we address our concern about the parking with the desk staff he told us they would not be parked there very long. However the next morning the same cars were still parked along the red curb along with a few more cars. Safety is a concern when I travel which is why I only gave an average rating.  The
Manager Response: I want to thank you for your loyalty in coming back to stay with us and commenting on the quiet rooms, which is definately a plus after a long day at Disneyland or the Convention Center! I am so sorry about the parking situation. We have open parking throguhout the lot and are working with the other area hotels to ensure they are not allowing their guests to park in our area of the lot, which should alleviate the issue. At the time you stayed with us we had just changed over to the transportation company. All issues have now been ironed out and there is a pickup directly in front of our hotel and the buses that are being used are much larger and we will run even larger buses during the summer months to ensure we do not run into this type of situation again.

Summary: great service gorgeous rooms with an awesome view of ca adventure
Manager Response: You said it all in one sentence! Thank you so much for the wonderful response!

Summary: Went for a quick 5 night trip to Disneyland and stayed at the HGI.  More of a Best Western than a regular Hilton, but it was clean and the staff were fantastic!!!  We usually stay in 4 star hotels, so this was place was not luxurious, but certainly VERY comfortable.  The front desk Staff were Fantastic & Friendly!!  They helped me with all my requests and very quickly!!  I forgot the keys to my suitcase and they had a maintenance person at my room under 3 mins to cut the lock off.  We were about to miss the shuttle to Disneyland and one of their front desk staff members ran out and held the driver for us!!  They offered us bottled water every evening and when we were heading to the park.  They offer a great little breakfast in the morning, kids eat free and the staff remembered
Manager Response: I'm so glad that you noticed and took the time to let everyone know that we really do like what we do! It's a great observation and I must say very true. Life is short, we spend a whole bunch of it at work, it doesn't make sense not to enjoy what you're doing! I look forward to meeting you or one of the people you have recommended to the hotel one of these days!

Summary Heading: Real enjoyable stay - will be back
Summary: Just finishing up a week at the hotel. I must say in all of my years staying at hotels, this ranks up there as one of the most friendliest staff I have ever encountered.   Mark (and Theresa in housekeeping who dried and folded our clothes late one evening), Jeanette at the desk - Rigo, James and Maria at the American Grill, you guys rock - all amazing people who truly want you to enjoy your stay. The rooms were very clean and the housekeeping staff did a top notch job keeping it that way. This is the way a hotel needs to be run - dedicated and motivated people! I do notice the General Manager keeps in touch with this site - so please sir, take this crew out for a well deserved night out as you are extrememely blessed to have these people on the front lines of this hotel - we
Manager Response: I love logging on and finding a most excellent review like yours! What stands out is that you remember so many people by name. That really tells me we are making it memorable for you! Next time you stay I hope to meet you so I am able make the memory banks! Thank you for the great information, now I must go to celebrate your comments with the whole team!

Summary: A decent hotel near Disneyland.  The breakfast is hot and a full one.  Not skimpy at all.  The staff was terrific and fixed everything that went wrong, but we had:  1)  a hairdryer that caught fire 2)  a sleep number bed that was stuck on 10 (hard) 3)  burnt out bulbs in the bathroom  Everything was quickly fixed when we reported it, and the staff friendly, but we shouldn't have had 3 issues in 3 days.  Rooms were clean if not a little shop worn.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great comments about the staff. We take great pride in service and accomodation and we are tremendously proud of the service experience you had. In regards to the three incidents, I would like to assure that what happened to you was an anomaly and by no means the norm. We would love to have the opportunity to make it up to you if possible. Please feel free to contact me or let me know when you are coming back to the area so we may provide you with not only fantastic service, but also amazing accomodations!

Summary Heading: Stay Away From This Hotel Like The Plague
Summary: Let's just say, when you think of Hilton this is not what comes to mind.  It looks like a cheap Holiday Inn on the interior. Cheesy styling and plain decor.   I was appalled at the smell and disgusting way in which this hotel presents itself. We paid 70 a night and wished we would have paid double to stay at a hotel that at least put some effort in to cleaning their establishment.  We were on the top floor (reserved for Hilton Honor guests) and I seriously had a hard time walking on the filthy carpets with shoes on. I don't know why they wouldn't put some effort into cleaning the public carpets. If that's the way they kept the public areas cleaned how well do they do with the rooms.  Speaking of the rooms. The beds are HORRIBLE. They have the adjustable beds that don't adjust.
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for what sounds like an awful stay. I wish I would have had the opportunity to discuss these issues with you during the course of your stay so I would have had the opportunity to make it right. I assure you we take great pride in our accomodations, in fact generally our cleanliness, customer service, and cooked to order breakfast are two of the most complimented services from our guests. I have reviewed your comments with our entire management team  and  rest assured that no guest in the future will have the type of stay you had.

Summary Heading: Great location, clean room, easy access to Disney/highway
Summary: We enjoyed our room, the friendly front desk staff, and the easy parking.  The bed was comfy, and we didn't have any problems with outside noise filtering into the room at night while we were trying to sleep.  The location to Disney and the highway is also great, and the price was a decent value.  My two biggest complaints are that the king size bed we had did not have king size pillows - it had regular pillows, which were a pain while sleeping.  If we rolled, we rolled off the pillow even though we were still on the bed.  My other complaint is that I think it's ridiculous to pay for parking at a hotel, especially a hotel not located in a downtown, urban area.  Yes, I know that many area hotels charge for parking since it's near Disneyland, but it's still ridiculous.  Husband's
Manager Response: I want to thank you for taking the time to write about your your stay here with us. You touched on just about every aspect of the hotel and I take great pride in the comments you made about all the great services we provide. In regards to the breakfast, although there is a charge, but I must say our breakfast is fantastic! A full breakfast buffet with all hot items cooked to order. One way to save and enjoy our breakfast, is to book into our Bed and Breakfast rate, that would only cost you an additional $5.00 per person. I want to thank you again for taking the time to let us know what a good job we are doing!

Summary Heading: Hilton Garden Inn is a Wonderful Place to Stay!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn from 12/22 - 12/26 and were very pleased. I got a great rate on the hotel through Expedia, which made it all even better. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and the staff -- front desk, restaurant, housekeeping -- were all super helpful and friendly as can be. We used the hot tub on the first night, which was great, and the pool and fitness room are both really nice. They even have an on-site laundry facility, which was quite convenient.  Our room was about perfect -- clean and comfortable. The only negative is the walls seem to be a bit thin as we could hear a lot of noise coming from neighboring rooms. (You'd think that Hilton would know how to build hotels with thicker walls.) Also, the water pressure in the shower, while decent,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I haven't been impressed by a hotel in a long time. When I walked in with my family of three I knew I was going to have a great stay. Young man at the front desk checked us in expeditiously, was very helpful and offered us fresh baked cookies. Staying for 8 nights to go to Disneyland. However I might give Mickey a break and hang out at the pool or the room one day away from the park.
Manager Response: Do you know what I think is great about your review?   The fact that we managed to stay true to your first impression! You were here for eight days (and what I would imagine about 400 miles of walking in the Parks) and we managed to stay true with the quality of our service and accomodations. Thank you for the kind words and we look forard to having you back with us the next time you are in town!

Summary Heading: Everything you want from a HGI
Summary: Spent 3 days with the family at disneyland, this HGI did everything you would expect.  Great Pool area, kept well maintained and clean.  Nice room with fridge and microwave, a good breakfast in the morning, cookies at night.  The staff did a great job making sure we had everything we needed.  Overall, it a good solid place to stay at a reasonable price.
Manager Response: You really summed us up! I really appreciate you acknowledging us our cleanliness and all we have to offer. I always love to hear good things about our pool area, I feel it is one of our hidden attributes that not too many people comment on. Thanks!

Summary Heading: A really nice hotel for a really good price
Summary: The hotel was very clean which was my number 1 priority.  The staff was very kind and helpful.  I got a really good rate so I think the hotel was definitely worth the money I spend.  Clean, friendly staff, and a shuttle to Disneyland. What more could I ask for?  Staying at this hotel was definitely a wonderful experience, and I will stay there again at the end of this month.  I would recommend this hotel for anyone just wanting a clean & an inexpensive hotel.
Manager Response: I never grow tired of great comments (especially about our cleanliness and service). I really appreciate you taking the time out to write about your great experience with us and look forward to having you back at the end of the month. Make sure you say hello!

Summary: I stayed here for a seminar that took place at the Embassy Suites hotel, just across the parking lot. Better price than the Embassy Suites, but now I'm not sure based on a few issues with the hotel and room I checked in to find that the room that I booked; Evolution room king, was given away.  In addition I had requested a high floor away from the elevator. I was given a high floor, but right next to the elevator. Why ask guests their preferences if the hotel cannot honor it? That was sorted out. I did get a king, but it was anything but like the Evolution room they advertise. The last evolution room I stayed at was in HGI in Loma Linda, which consisted of two room; living room and bedroom with lots of room to spread out. The HGI in Garden grove was not like this, but just a one
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write out such a detailed description of the unfortunately events that took place. We take price in our service and accomodations and seem to have fallen short. I have discussed your comments with the management team and have reminded our team members the importance of being proactive. I am not certain of the time frame that you stayed with us, but around the time this was posted we had some issues with routers throughout the hotel that have now been addressed and are working at a much higher speed. All the other maintenance and housekeeping issues have been addressed as well. Please feel free to give me a call here at the hotel if there is anything I may be able to do to make it up to you for the challenges you had.

Summary: Location very good, not so far from Disney, anyway, there is a shuttle bus nearby to get there. Breakfast, no complain, my daughter loved it so much. All the people there are very nice and really helpful. Room, one of the best that I've known so far, although I wish separate bedroom and living room is better, but not necesary.
Manager Response: One word, AWESOME! Your comments showcase what a great job the team is doing. It makes me happy that your daughter loved her breakfast. I would like to say that I agree her in the fact that I feel that we have one of the best cooked to order breakfast and buffet in the area. Thanks again

Summary: The hotel was great and we really enjoyed our stay. My only complaint is that parking was on the expensive side and there wasn't a microwave nor fridge to accommodate small children.
Manager Response: I always enjoy hearing about how clean we are!  I know we have some of the hardest working Housekeepers in Anaheim so it is nice to have them recognized! I  want to point out that we do in fact have microwavess and refrigerators in all of our guest room, so it may have been an oversight, but I do appreciate you taking the time out to make post your comments.

Summary Heading: Excellent alternative to convention hotels nearby
Summary: I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel in 2009.  My room was very comfortable and close to the convention site (Hyatt Regency Orange County).  The room was quiet, bed comfortable,  and I slept well.  The front desk had a bit of trouble locating a package that was supposed to be waiting for me, but I forgive this error.  The hotel is unpretentious, comfortable, and clean.
Manager Response: We are so glad that you decided to come back and stay with us again!  It sounds like we got everything just about right (next time I promise, we'll have the package tracking down!). We look forward to having you back next time you are in town to attend a meeting/convention.

Summary Heading: Home away from home - highly recommended!!
Summary: From the moment we arrived at the Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim we were greeted warmly by all staff members and made to feel extremely welcome.  The check-in staff was efficient, friendly and most accommodating, patiently answering our questions and trying to find us the best room to meet our needs.  When we got to our room we found it was spacious, modern and very clean and bright, with a fridge and microwave, large flat screen TV and nice linen.  The whole room was clean and in good repair, the bathroom was nicely laid out with all amenities including shampoo, shower gel, conditioner, vanity kit, shower cap, hairdryer and adequate towels for the whole family.  The rest of the hotel was equally nice; the swimming pool and hot tub were enclosed within a nice garden and a very
Manager Response: We cannot thank you enough for taking the time to write such an extensive email that really breaks down what the hotel has to offer. As much pride as we take in our accomodations, the fact that the service we provided was to the caliber that you wrote about makes me proud as a manager! Thanks!

Summary Heading: 5 star service at a fraction of the cost
Summary: I stayed here recently while attending a conference and was very impressed by the customer service and professionalism. And it wasn't just 1 or 2 employees trying extra hard. The entire staff, from front desk to bus boy to house keeping, was smiling, friendly and going out of their way to my trip pleasant. There were numerous occasions where in a similar level of hotel, I would have been nickled and dimed for picking up a Fed Ex package, etc. These were all free, fast and friendly. The rooms, fitness center, lobby, etc were all clean and pretty standard. It was definitely the wonderful staff that made this trip review-worthy.
Manager Response: It is always a great thing to hear that our staff is doing things right! We take great pride in our service and making sure that each and every guest feels they are getting the five star treatment! Thank you very much for your kind words.

Summary: A few blocks from Disney.  The price was right and the Hilton Garden was very clean.  Staff was nice and near other restaurants.
Manager Response: Wow, thanks for the great review and for making us your hotel of choice when you are in the Anaheim area. Nex t time you are in, please let me know so that I may thank you personally for taking the time out of your day to let others know what we are doing right!

Summary: My first stay at this particular property.  It is OK, but it reminds me a a property that Hilton may have purchased and subsequently turned into an HGI.  I ended up in an accessible room so maybe that is part of the problem, but this property just did not seem as 'nice' as many of the others that I have visited.  The room were very quiet, but the beds did not sleep very well overall.  I guess I would stay here again if I had to, but would probably check out some of the other local HIlton properties first.
Manager Response: We are glad you chose to stay with us and are glad that you enjoyed the good service peace and quiet we were able to provide (which can be a great thing after a long day at a local convention or Disneyland!) . Based on your review of our 'Garden Sleep System' beds, we may have failed to properly explain how the beds have a dial at the tops of the mattress that allows you to choose the feel of the air baffle mattress to fit your likings (firm or soft). I must admit the dials are a bit hidden. Also, I would like to give you my assurance that we were built as, and will always be a Hilton Garden Inn! Again, we thank you for your patronage and would love to have the opportunity to 'WOW' you on your next visit to the area!

Summary: Stayed at this Hilton for 3  nights for our Disney vaca. Pretty close to Disneyland, maybe a 20 min walk. Service was great, Val the reservation manager went out of her way to accomodate our needs, which was very appreciated. Not sure that I would chose this hotel again if I were to go back to Anaheim, but over all not bad at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about us and the nice comments about the service, it's always great when a guest remembers an employee by name! We truly hope you do decide to visit us next time you are in the area, I pledge that we will make your next stay outstanding!

Summary Heading: Great stay, great staff and reasonable price
Summary: We stayed here the first week of June. It's a very good hotel if you are going to Disneyland!.  The room are clean, (white linens) and the price is reasonable with a great breakfast selection, cooked to order!  I booked the rate with breakfast included.  I got everything I requested and more.  I got my bottled water, extra pillows  and my kids got disney puzzles!   The room has a mini fridge and microwave that came in handy for a tiring day at Disneyland.  The hotel has a pantry where you can buy ice cream, mac and cheese and other foods and they are reasonably priced.  You can buy ART tickets at the front desk.  Complimentary internet, a tad slow for me but ok.  Coin laundry came in handy too.  Hotel is within walking distance to Target, Red Robin etc.   The front desk staff
Manager Response: We love your positive review! We take great pride in our service and cleanlines, so it's great to hear that we gor it right! I will make sure to commend Mark on the lasting impression he left with you. We appreciate your loyalty and can't wait to have you back with us!

Summary: Check in seemed a bit disconnected and rushed, but that seems pretty par for the course at  any Hilton property. I mean it's professional, but lacks warmth and sincerity. We are HHonors Gold members so we were given cold bottles of water and vouchers for the breakfast buffet for in the morning. We requested a room away from the elevators and on a high floor. We got both. The room was fairly well appointed. I enjoyed the large workspace with the amazing Herman Miller chair. The desk lamp fell apart in my hands, but it was a quick fix. I put it back together myself. We tried to watch TV but for some odd reason the flat screen TV was blurry and was very limited on channels. We decided to go swimming instead. The pool was awesome.  It was very shaded though. It would have been nice
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking  the time to write such a desriptive, well thought out review of our property. With all the choices you have we are glad that you chose to stay with us and that you will be back for a future visit! Next time we promise to change your opinion from 'Average, but enjoyable' to 'Outstanding, and enjoyable'

Summary Heading: OK Hotel, friendly and efficient staff
Summary: Stayed here for one night on a business trip. Hotel is OK, clean and quiet. Unlike other places in this category, staff are friendly and efficient. Nothing special in the surrounding, unless of course Disneyland... Free parking; free internet. Nothing to complain about.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing us when you were in the Anaheim area on business! We are always happy to hear that you enjoyed the friendly staff and clean rooms. Our goal for your next visit is change your mind from just an 'OK Hotel' to an 'Outstanding Hotel'!  Best regards,  Keith Moses General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, no breakfast, whack parking
