Summary: Stayed here for a few days while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  We never stayed in this hotel before so we thought we'd give it a shot.  The hotel is fairly new and in a great location near stores, dining, and close to Disneyland.    The Pros: Location is great.  There is a Target across the street and several restaurants within a block.  Disneyland is only a couple of minutes away by car.  The hotel is fairly new.  The rooms were in nice condition and the lobby was inviting with a lot of room to sit and hang out.  The staff is very friendly.  They provide Coffee, Decaf, and hot water for tea/hot cocoa in the lobby 24 hrs a day.  Not the greatest coffee but it's complimentary if you want it.  The Cons:  Parking lot lines are painted to close together in many areas making it a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice, but if you are going to Disney try to stay closer
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for three nights.  While the hotel is nice enough (but not exactly the four seasnos) and clean, it's too far from Disney.  While it's possible to walk, it's pretty far (2 miles to the park entrance)  This is especially tiring when you are walking in the parks all day.  Also, parking is $14 per day.  If you park at Disney that is also $14 per day, so you will be spending $28/day just to park.  There's a shuttle, but if you don't like public transportation how likely are you to use it?  Overall, I'd say this is a good budget hotel, but you can probably find better.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel on business on and off for 4 years.  Its consistanly well priced, with good service, friendly staff and great access to attractions, restaurants and the trolly.  Perfect for business as though their are familys with children going to the park, rooms are quiet and amenities are ample.  Would reccomentd
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first trip to California and I looked and worried over all the hotel choices in the Anaheim area because I was afraid of getting a yucky hotel.   Garden Inn is incredible!  The room was large with a king size bed with a soft down type comforter.  There was also a 32 inch size flat screen tv.  We had a coffee maker with coffee supplies and a mini frig.  All this was included in our price!   The room was cleaned every day and I just can't say enough about the staff there.   Satbeer was incredible and anything we needed he and all the other employees were there to assist.   They always had a smile on their faces and there is complimentary coffee, tea and hot cocoa every morning down in the lobby area.  They have a business center with three computers and printer that

Summary Heading: Strong Service Ethic Makes A Difference
Summary: I was staying at this hotel for 4 nights during a recent tradeshow.  The hotel is modern, tastefully decorated and has all of the functions one might expect.  I arrived late in the evening, but the staff greeted me cheerfully, anticipated my needs, and provided me a choice of rooms.  The room itself is a standard size, but was well-lit, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was quite spacious.  The free internet was appreciated.  I've stayed in a few HGIs and the decor is similar, but pleasant while being understated, and the spotless white bedsheets and linen were nice after a long journey.  The rooms were well constructed from a soundproofing perspective and insulation and ventilation were both very good, and easy to adjust in terms of temperature.  I would say that it is

Summary: I was in Garden Inn   sept. 11  to sept 16 and it was great .The ben so confy , the staff very nice so clean and near to evething . I´ll be there in my netx vacation..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your busy day to write comments about your recent stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Anahiem/Garden Grove. Summary: We stayed at the HGI in Garden Grove in August of 2009 for two nights.  We stayed in the area for a visit to Disneyland.   The ART transportation(which costs 4 dollars a day for an adult to ride) stopped very close to the hotel and made it easy to get to Disneyland.   The hotel does charge you to park at 12 dollars a night, a little steep, but certainly not out of the ordinary in Anaheim.   My wife and I thought the staff of the hotel was very nice.  The front desk staff helped with all of our needs.   The restaurant only cooks breakfast in the morning.    The hotel is typical of a Hilton Garden property with a small outdoor pool and business center.    We found our bed a little lumpy.    The biggest complaint we had was with the shower head. Summary: the room was never cleaned and the rug was wet from water leakage
Manager Response: none

Summary: I picked this hotel for a business trip for myself and my boss based on the price, location, and TripAdvisor reviews. We were flying in to LAX and had an event in Irvine and Anaheim so the location seemed ideal. I called at 3:00 PM the day of arrival and advised them we would not be arriving at the hotel until at least 10:00 PM but it was booked through Expedia and paid. When we arrived there were zero parking spots, we had to park half on the curb and half in a spot...same thing night 2! I had reserved 2 rooms with king beds and requested a high floor. We got a room on 1 and a room on 2, both with two queen beds. The rooms were sweltering even with the AC on. Summary: Stayed here three nights for a family trip to Disneyland.  No complaints.  What we expected from a "chain" hotel.  Clean rooms, basic breakfast.  A little to far for kids to walk , but the shuttle to Disney was a short distance across the parking lot and we found it very convenient.  Buca di Beppo Italian restaurant is in the adjacent parking lot and we enjoyed dinner there one evening.  Only downside is that parking can be tough if you arrive late.  This HGI shares a mega-parking lot with the Embassy Suites and Hampton Inn, so on a busy day (we were there during Spring Break) parking can be tough unless you want to park in the back of the hotels.  No complaints and would stay here again.  We have stayed at the Disney hotels before, but they can be very pricey, so this is a good
Manager Response: none

Summary: Me and my boyfriend stayed here from May 28th thru June 1st and we enjoyed out stay. We booked our stay through Disney and when we booked we asked for a King bedm but when we checked in they gave us a room with 2 doubles but the front desk cleared that up quickly and got us into a King room asap. Also, parking was great, there wass always a spot right in the front. I have to agree the beds are way too firm for my liking but we went to Anaheim for Disneyland so the room was just for sleep. The front desk staff was helpful and understanding and allowed us to check out a little later than the usual 12pm. The rooms were super clean and big. Also, if you are going to this hotel for Disneyland, the Anaheim Resort Transit picks up right on the side of the hotel by the Embassy Suites

Summary: If you are coming here, the first thing you might want to do is to reiterate to your transfer agent/cab driver/etc that you are going to HGI and not Hilton Anaheim ("Big Hilton"). HGI is just down the same road but it is 1, 2 blocks away and you won't want to lug your bags that far.   Location-wise it is really average - about 15-20 minutes' walk to Disneyland (I am assuming most visitors come here for that). Then again, Big Hilton is just half that distance, plus there are a lot of hotels/inns here to choose from, so...   The area shuttle pops by the HGI block (a cluster of inns) but you might want to check out the very peaceful neighborhood instead which we loved for its serenity (it could have been the weather). Joe's Crab Shack is a street away and many eateries line the way
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose this hotel primarily because of its proximity to Disneyland and its advertised special "comfort sleep" system beds.  Both my husband and mother-in-law have bad backs and this seemed like a huge plus (also I am pregnant and need a comfortable mattress).  Trust me- they are awful!  Waaaay too firm despite having an adjustable dial.  It's like sleeping on  a sack of concrete.  If you adjust it to "soft," instead of being 100% rock hard, the mattress will cave in somewhat, providing you with a little divot to sleep in (and yes- it still stays pretty hard).  If you wish to book adjoining rooms, be advised that they may or may not be able to honor your request even if you call ahead way in advance.  We ended up moving rooms after one night in order to get adjoining rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After a lot of research on hotels in the Anaheim area, decided to give the Hilton Garden Inn a try, we were not disappointed at all. We stayed 4 nights and our main purpose of staying here wasn't just for Disney, we wanted to have a day on the coast and also go to Hollywood. Check-in was quick and efficient and we went to out room on the 3rd floor. The room was pretty much spotless and well equipped with fridge, microwave, iron & board, and 32" flat screen TV and neutrogena tolietries. The only thing I would say was missing was an in-room safe. Very comfy beds, a work desk with a cool chair and also another comfy chair. Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family and my brother-in-law's family came to Garden Grove to visit Disneyland. We chose this hotel over other hotels because they had a great bed and breakfast rate and free parking (at the time of booking). But FYI, the free parking is no more. I found out that they have started charging for parking ($12 per day) in March. They waived our parking fee because we booked in January. A downside was that sometimes there were not enough parking spots. But the hotel let us park in a curb spot.  We arrived late because we had an evening flight, but the hotel was speedy in checking us in. The rooms were clean and looked newly renovated. Service was friendly and efficient. Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed here while vacationing at Disneyland.  We arrived early on a Friday, but they had our room ready and allowed us to check in.  We were able to drop off our luggage and head straight to Disneyland.  The room was very typical Hilton Garden, which I mean as a compliment.  It was very clean and fairly spacious.  Also, because it isn't a "Suites" hotel, there were fewer families with young children.  This was a plus for us and made for very quiet evenings.  Because I'm a Hilton Honors Diamond member, our breakfast was free, but I think it is $13 for the full buffet (less if you go ala carte).    The shuttle to DIsneyland stops in front of the Embassy Suites next store, which was a very short walk.  The Hilton Garden front desk sells the one day passes for the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, clean hotel but min. perks
Summary: I booked the Hilton Gardens because they were fairly close to Disneyland(about 1.5 miles) and their pricing was very fair.    Parking is free but no free breakfast like Hampton Inn, which is a Hilton Hotel also.  Hilton Gardens, Embassy Suites and Hampton are located on the same lot.  Shuttle for Disneyland is $4 and leaves every 20 mins from Embassy Suites, it's an all day pass.  Family staying at Hampton also received $25 gas card.  I didn't book at Hampton because they were $159 per night vs $125 for Hilton Garden.  Didn't know about the gas card otherwise I would have booked there!  Since we had a 14 month old, we requested a crib.  The hotel uses Pack and Plays as the crib. Not too shabby.  The room has a completely empty fridge for you to stock up on your own items.

Summary: Nicely located, quiet hotel.  We found our room to be clean and comfortable.  We usually request rooms away from the elevator to avoid hearing people coming and going.  Our room was on the 4th floor at the end of the hallway.   I liked that the hotel provided free wireless throughout the hotel.   The pool area was pretty and towels were provided.  In the late afternoon we heard some construction/jack hammering from across the street, but it wasn't horrible.   There was some debris in the pool, but considering wind and how the entire pool is banked by shrubs and flowering bushes it's understandable. Summary: I stayed here for the American Library Association conference. It was one of the official hotels. It was only about a 20 minute walk to the convention center, so that was decent. I think Disneyland would add another 15 minutes to that walk. On the whole it was a decent place at a decent rate. The most favorable thing was how quiet the room was. I'm used to hearing a fair amount of noise from other rooms--walking around, televisions, laughter--and I didn't hear any of that. The room itself could have used just a bit of care. The track to the closet door was mangled and made it difficult to open. The faucet on the sink was getting loose from the basin. But there was nothing major. Summary: Stayed here for 1 night in May 2008.  This was a good hotel - very comfortable and clean.  A bit on the pricey side - but I felt I got value for money given the condition of the hotel and the cleanliness and comfort. Not far from Disneyland.  I would recommend this hotel and would probably stay there again.

Summary: Stayed here after leaving Anaheim Hilton due to noisy renovations, and recommend you do the same. Nice amenities of small refrigerator and microwave, flat screen TV, and quality bath soaps. I stayed in a room overlooking the pool and hot tub; and some late night noise from the party going on the patio near the pool, and street traffic. Summary: We stayed there on May 7-10, 2008.   THE ROOMS: The rooms are very quiet and nicely appointed. Lots of Neutrogena amenities. Room includes a microwave and a refrigerator (!). The beds are very comfortable.  THE STAFF: This hotel had, perhaps, the BEST hotel staff I have ever dealt with. They are all remarkably outgoing and quite anxious to help you have a great stay. I was very impressed.  THE PROPERTY: The lobby features a "Pantry" filled with cold drinks and sandwiches, as well as all kinds of things you may need or want or may have forgotten. You just take what you need and they charge it to your room.  This is a great feature that came in very handy.  Another plus of this property is that is has a sophisticated "Hilton" feel, which means that there are not lots of screaming

Summary: On a recent trip to LA, my girlfriend and I decided that a visit to Disneyland was in order.  Having looked at a variety of hotels I decided to give the Hilton Garden Inn a chance mainly due to the incredibly low rate being offered on the Hilton website.  I figured we'd be in the room overnight so if it wasn't great it wouldn't matter.  Upon arrival at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised.  The entrance and lobby looked very nice and the availability of free self parking was great.  We were quickly checked in to the hotel and shown up to the 3rd floor by the person who checked us in. Summary: We stayed at this hotel in February and March of 2008. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay and a good value for a family of 4. I would strongly recommend spending the few extra dollars to for the made to order breakfast. I think they call it the bed & breakfast rate. It saved us time & money so we could get a good start in the morning. The choices for breakfast were omelettes, french toast, or pancakes in addition to a  buffet with fruit, cereal, breads, and juice.   The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. When we found our room's closet door was broken, they moved us to another room with no hassle. The room was very clean and a decent size for the cost. I would recommend staying on the second, third or fourth floors since the rooms are a little large than the first

Summary Heading: A very pleasant stay, with great staff
Summary: I recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for most of the month of February. Booking in Anaheim when traveling on business can be nerve-wracking - i had visions of sugar-fueled Disney-bound rugrats running the halls and was just hoping to find someplace quiet and comfortable. The Hilton Garden Inn filled that role very well. The initial leg of my stay was in a king room, which was nicely appointed and appeared to have updated bedding (a white duvet as opposed to the floral bedspread number I later encountered in a queen room.)  Despite being rather busy - full parking lot, breakfast room, etc - it was always quiet, which was perfect. During my stay, myself and my fellow work colleagues made many inquiries of the front desk staff - restaurant recommendations, travel advice, etc,

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel twice and have had no complaints.  Staff is always very nice.  Free hot breakfast.  The one issue that could have made my stay better was that the hot tub was broken, and I really like their hot tub--it has that fun fiber optic lighting that changes colors.  It was unfortunate, but at least they did come up with a solution -- I was able to use the Embassy Suites hot tub if I wanted to step out across the parking lot.  Not ideal, but they tried to accommodate and I appreciate that very much!  I will stay there again.

Summary: Just not a great hotel. Very sterile and boring. Not worth the price, considering the Hampton and the Embassy in the complex are virtually the same price. Location is good in the "Hilton Complex" with the other 2, and behind Buca. You can get your money's worth much better at the other 2, though. Don't waste your time.

Summary: My husband and I just wanted to say a big thank you to the staff at this hotel and helped make what turned out for us to be a trip from hell better. During our stay I recieved news my mother had died back in the UK and then our airline filed for bankrupcy, the staff were so friendly and helpfull, one young man in particular, I'm afraid I don't know his name but i'm sure he will remember the crazy English couple who spent most of their time in the business suite! The hotel is very clean and during our stay there was painting and renovations going on but I have to say even the painters were friendly and quiet. I would recommend this hotel no question and really hope to be back next  christmas for a less stressfull break.

Summary: Very nice  good staff decent rooms small poo; Get a room on the back side of the hotel  no free breakfast
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your review of the Hilton Garden Inn, Garden Grove and we are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Summary Heading: Poor compared to other Garden Inns
Summary: Really disappointed. As a silver Hhonors member I expected the usual niceties but found none.  Room cleaning was slow. The pool ran out of towels and no new ones were made available for 24 hours. The gym contained three items, one of which was permanently out of order. Breakfast was overpriced.  The crowning glory was being charged a day rate when requesting a 3.00pm check-out. Given that housekeeping were still cleaning rooms at 5.00pm this was outrageous.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to review The Hilton Garden Inn, Garden Grove; our sincerest apologies for your recent experience at our hotel. We want you to know that if at any time during your hotel stay, you require assistance, we hope that you would depend on our knowledgeable & hospitable front desk staff. As far as late check out is concerned, there is nothing we would like more than to be able to grant them to all of our guests. However, with the numerous requests that we receive daily, it makes it difficult to please everyone in this particular situation and is based on hotel availability.    We are also looking forward to our remodel in 2008 which will also allow us new fitness center equipment. We are very pleased that you chose us for your hotel accommodations and hope that you will reconsider us in the future as your patronage is very important to us. Hilton Garden Inn, Anaheim/Garden Grove is dedicated to providing exceptional guest service & our goal is ensure that your experience exceeds your expectations.

Summary: Flew in to LA on the 5th of October on route to Vegas, so we wanted somewhere in a nice area to stay for a couple of days before driving over to Sin City. Summary Heading: Great for families, no better value in the area, now a repeat customer!
Summary: Let me say first that this is a really great place to stay, especially when traveling with young children.  The hotel is quiet, exceptionally clean, very close to Disneyland, has a free shuttle, free parking, free full breakfast (booked with [--]), frige, microwave and coffee maker in the rooms.  Beds were SUPER comfy, as were the pillows.  Housekeeping staff were great, left extra trash bags and toiletries for us (by our request) without blinking an eye. Summary: The Hilton Garden Inn, Garden Grove is a great example of value, convenience and location.  I was in Anaheim for a meeting at the Convention Center and was incredibly happy with the accomodations. The rooms are modern, clean, quiet and include a refrigerator, complimentary coffe and a microwave.   It is an easy walk to the Convention Center and there are plenty of restaurants along Harbor Blvd.  It is an easy shuttle to Disney.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I forgot a few articles of clothing at check out and a few days later the hotel staff contacted me and sent them at no charge via overnight mail!

Also, my husband loves it because he doesn't feel as claustrophobic at 6'5".  The staff has always been friendly and accomodating.  Unfortuately, I can't say the same for the Hilton down the road. Summary Heading: Great location for Disney & Knotts Berry

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Okay...my family and I stayed at this hotel only one night to visit Disneyland California Adventures.  Upon arrival, the staff was not friendly, but not rude either.  The room that we were given smelled like mold the minute we opened the door as it appeared that the air conditioner had not been on in days.  I requested another room, which the hotel manager gladly accomodated.  This room was much better, the air conditioner was on and the room was free of any smells.  Once in that new room, our stay was average.  We got what we paid for at $119.00 for the night.  The plusses were free parking and within minutes of Disney.  Although we drove our car, the shuttle runs from the neighboring hotel, for a fee.

Summary Heading: Compare 3 Hilton Hotels w/in 1 Block- Cheapest & cleanest
Summary: I knew from previous stays in the Garden Grove/Anaheim ares that there are 3 Hilton properties within 1 Block of each other: Hilton Garden Inn(HG), Embassy Suites(ES) and Hampton Inn(HI). In fact, they share the same big parking lot & use the same shuttle service. I've stayed in all 3 so here's a comparison: - HG is newest and least expensive ($99), it's the cleanest of the 3. This is probably because it's new; but also there are fewer families with kids staying here.  - The HG does not have a free buffet breakfast like the HI and the ES. - Rooms in the HG, HI & ES all have microwaves and mini-fridges. - Outdoor Pool area in the HG is nicer and quieter; but pool is smaller at the HG than the ES & HI. Summary: Based on the reviews and ratings of readers, my 11yr old daughter and I stayed at the HGI from 16-24 March 2006 and had a wonderful time.
